Apple Pro Speakers ( the translucent round speakers )
This is a good section to comment on the speed of the machine with the 1 GHz processor .
the most processor intensive task I have undertaken on the iMac is movie editing .
For this , I found the iMac to be plenty fast , at time did I like I needed more speed .
I really that the Mac world is more focused on usability than raw speed , as is the case with the PC world .
The PC world is filled with specs benchmarks , you do n't see this nearly as often in the Mac world ( although you do see it ) .
The first thing I did to my iMac was to add memory .
From a performance per dollar standpoint , nothing beats additional RAM.
So I purchased a 512MB memory board from CompUSA for around $ 120 to bring the total memory up to 768MB.
I have upgraded the memory in all the computers I have owned , so I did n't even bother trying the machine with the 256MB.
My recommendation be for around $ 100 get the extra memory - it 's a brainer .
From a hardware perspective , I also note that you get an internal wireless card for the iMac.
The Airport Extreme wireless card for the iMac works with the AirPort Extreme Base Station using 802.11g for up to 54 Mbps , which is about 5 times faster than the currently most popular standard of 802.11b .
The Airport Extreme Card is also compatible with 802.11b you already have a wireless router based on the older standard .
I have a wireless network in my house , but have the iMac sitting next to the router .
Therefore , I just connected it with an Ethernet cable .
However , I was to place it elsewhere in the house , the internal wireless feature be nice as it eliminate an external box .
I have actually about putting it in the family room , since it looks so nice , it fit right into the decor .
All is lost however .
First of all , I do n't currently have a need for it .
second , you buy a tiny D-Link DBT-120 bluetooth adapter that plugs into a USB port for about $ 50 .
The D-Link adapter is tiny at 1.81 " x 0.73 " x 0.37" , so you just plug it in you do n't see it .
One thing I advise is to replace the Apple Pro Speakers with a better system you are going to do a ton of music listening , as the Pro Speakers have absolutely zero low end .
So far , I have kept them - but I will replace them at some point .
GETTING STARTED
I turned on the machine went through the setup procedure .
I was ready to roll .
When first using the iMac , one word comes to mind , that is " slick" .
Everything looks so nice crisp stylish .
The way the icons look , the way the applications launch .
The images to jump off the screen they are so lifelike .
Unlike most PC 's that convert the digital image to analog , where it is sent through a cable to the monitor , the iMac display has a direct digital connection to the video card .
The high-quality of the monitor combined with the digital connection is what makes the monitor look the way it does .
I started playing around with the applications , they were very intuitive .
Anyone used to a Windows machine will find it very easy to use the Mac .
Sure , it is slightly different , but the general concepts of pulldown menus are the same .
The one thing I did notice however is that I missed a 2-button mouse .
Rather , you simply push down on the mouse itself the whole mouse "is " the button .
However , that was the case , as there really was second button to click .
I figure Apple will eventually smarten up offer a 2-button version .
Another area where the iMac was was in user switching .
My wife I had separate user accounts on the XP machine .
We switch back forth on the XP machine , leaving applications open .
With the Mac OS X ( also called Jaguar ) , you need to completely log off ( close all applications ) in order to switch between users .
The good news is that the next version of software , called Panther , is due out from Apple on 10/24/03 .
Panther adds a number of features , one of them is user switching similar in functionality to XP.
With the Mac , the "home " key takes you to the beginning of a document versus the beginning of the line with a PC .
The "end " key on the Mac takes you to the end of the document versus the end of the line with a PC .
To go to the beginning end of the line on the Mac , you need to use the up down arrow keys .
Minor quibbles of course , but anyone used to Windows find it a bit confusing at first - in practice .
Other than the issues mentioned above , I found the iMac OS X to be very easy to use .
Keep in mind , this was just basic usability , nothing application specific .
Read on to find out how the iMac stacked up from an applications standpoint .
APPLICATIONS
The iLife suite of applications ( which come with the iMac ) was one reason I went with the iMac.
iMovie - import movies from your camcorder edit them
iPhoto - import , manage , edit print photos , easily order prints photo albums
iDVD - put your iMovie projects on DVD and/or create DVD-based slideshows of your photos from iPhoto
iTunes - import , manage music from your CD 's downloaded music
Since the iLife applications are so central to the iMac experience , I wanted to really focus on them from the standpoint of "how " I use them how easy they are to use .
I found it to be exhausting tedious to try to find the best application for doing these things on the PC .
There were way too many choices .
So after playing around with the iMac getting a for it , the next day I focused on the iLife applications .
Over the past few years , I have accumulated many hours worth of video featuring my now 2 year old son .
I had been itching to put them on DVD , but it like such a chore .
I did fool around a little on the PC trying to make a movie , but I did n't find it all that intuitive , it a little flaky .
It even had transition effects ( e .g .
fade in , fade out ) , titles credits , a few songs I imported from some CD 's !
I simply connected my JVC MiniDV camcorder pressed a button to import the footage .
The iMovie application to detect the various points in the video where I stopped started recording .
So different pieces of footage that I took on the same tape were stored on the " storyboard " as individual clips .
Then I simply took the individual clips dragged them into a timeline at the bottom of the screen .
One clip run into the other .
However , I wanted to put in a transition effect between the two clips , I simply selected from a list of effects dragged the effect icon between the two clips on the timeline .
You name each clip , then see a list of the clip names in order to build a "scene selection " for a DVD ( same as the scene selection feature on DVD 's you rent ) .
I then used iDVD to burn my movie , I was loving life .
The experience of making my first movie exceeded any all expectations I had going into the process .
As for performance , it was great .
I describe it as very responsive , at time did I wish it was faster .
After your photos are stored in the library ( which by default is organized by "roll " of digital film which is dated be renamed to whatever you 'd like ) , you create albums .
You then select pictures from the library drag them into an album .
I have found iPhoto to be very easy to use have even scratched the surface of its capabilities .
For instance , I know you put in descriptions of individual photos , then search all of iPhoto for photos that contain a keyword .
The advanced features are there , but they are n't "in your face " like they are with PC applications .
Once I got some pictures from my digicam into iPhoto , I also found out how easy it was to e-mail photos to my friends .
I open the photo , resize is , save it as a compressed JPEG , then open Outlook attach the images to an e-mail send it .
With iPhoto , you simply select the photos you want to send , then press the e-mail icon at the bottom of the iPhoto interface .
It brings up a window which allows you to select a size of small , medium , large full size as well as two check boxes asking you want to include comments titles , that 's it .
I usually select medium ( which is 640 x 480 ) .
This automatically opens up an e-mail with the photos attached , at which time I write my e-mail text hit send .
So easy .
iPhoto also makes it extremely easy for the novice to post their photos to their own internet site with the addition of the .Mac service , but more on that later .
Lastly , you click on "order prints " "order book " to get your photos professionally processed to order a hard-bound book containing the photos from any of your albums .
When you order prints , the order is handled by Kodak .
sure who makes the albums , as I have done this yet , but they look beautiful .
They are hard bound covered in linen in a variety of colors .
Prints are $ 0.49
for 4 x 6 , $ 0.99 for 5 x 7 , $ 3.99 for 8 x 10 go all the way up to $ 19.99 for a 20 x 30 .
These services are commonplace for PC users , but the fact that they are so tightly integrated into iPhoto makes the process of ordering them MUCH easier .
This is something that has been intriguing to me , but have done it because it is n't all that intuitive on the PC .
It 's just that I wanted to take the steps to learn .
With iTunes , there is learning .
You just pop a CD in , iTunes opens , you listen to it drag songs into your music library .
iTunes works like iPhoto in terms of having a library then playlists ( equivalent to albums in iPhoto ) .
All your music gets placed into the library , then you create playlists which organize the music in the library .
So I drag one song into my " Mellow " playlist , another in my " Classical Music " playlist .
You name the playlists however you want , organize them accordingly .
Another very nice feature of iTunes is that along with your library playlists , iTunes also has a " Music Store " icon .
The beauty of this is that it does n't open an internet browser , necessitating a second interface to deal with .
Rather , the music is right there in iTunes .
When your music library playlists are selected , the search bar at the top of iTunes lets you search your own music for a group a song .
When you select the Music Store , the same search bar lets you search their online database .
After the song is downloaded , you simply drag it into one of your playlists just like any other song .
It is very simple , very easy to do .
I say that Apple has done enough to promote the iLife applications .
Sure , the of these built in applications was appealing to me , was a reason for purchasing the iMac.
However , I did n't them to transform the way I used a computer .
These applications far exceeded my expectations , I was running Apple I make even more of an effort in promoting them .
With iMovie iTunes , it was a joy to do both .
Also , iPhoto makes it much easier to manage share your photos , which means that I confident my photos are where I want them , easy to get to - versus lost in the midst of some folder somewhere .
In addition to the iLife suit of applications , some other applications the unit ships with are iCal , iChat , Address Book Mail .
Obviously the person who decided to put an "i" in front of Mail Address Book is longer with the company !
iCal is obviously a calendar application ( a calculator , but the iMac does come with one of those too ) .
iChat is an instant messaging application that works between Macs also is compatible with AOL Instant Messenger .
iChat does cross-platform ( Mac to PC ) videoconferencing , so I have used it yet .
As I mentioned earlier , I am using the Yahoo Messenger for this .
Address Book Mail are just what they sound like .
They are both very basic applications , but they do have one advantage .
That is , they integrate well with other Apple software .
you are used to Outlook , you will like Address Book , Mail iCal , as they are all SEPARATE applications .
why Apple decided on this .
It 's actually quite as bad as it sounds , as the applications do offer some integration/interaction with one another .
Still , you are an Outlook fan , then Microsoft Office X comes with Entourage X , which is a Mac version of Outlook .
I loaded Entourage X to try it out , I liked it very much .
However , I eventually stopped using it in favor of the Apple applications .
However , when I tried to have iPhoto send photos through Entourage , I got an error message .
I switched it to Apple Mail , it worked flawlessly .
That was enough to sell me on the of sticking with the Apple Applications .
Hopefully they will improve them over time .
I have the luxury of managing my calendar the majority of my contacts on my work machine , which is a PC running Outlook .
So my iMac is primarily used for e-mail managing some personal contacts .
I managed my business contacts on the iMac , I definitely toss iCal , Address Book Mail in favor of Entourage .
INTERNET THE .MAC SERVICE
I did n't find much of a difference between the PC Mac from a web-surfing standpoint .
One thing I guess I did notice was that Internet Explorer offered slower performance than it does on the PC platform .
The iMac does come with its own browser called Safari .
Safari does offer faster performance , much more responsive than Internet Explorer .
This makes a lot of sense since IE was built for the PC Safari was built for the Mac .
After using both , I actually preferred Safari , primarily because it offered tabbed browsing - which I had experienced before .
To explain , when you open a link in Internet Explorer , it will override the existing page , causing you to have to hit the "back " button to get back where you were .
IE also offers the ability to open the link in a new window , which means you do n't override the page you were on previously , but now you have two windows open .
Tabbed browsing simply allows you to open a link on another tab , within the same window .
you click a link in Safari , it will override the existing page just like IE.
However , you hold the apple button on the keyboard down when you click a link , it will add a tab at the top of the browser open the new page associated with the new tab .
You then click on the different tabs on the top of the browser window to switch between the pages , as well as click on the " x " on the tab itself to close the tab .
Personally , I like the concept of tabbed browsing , which is why I preferred Safari .
I also like the performance of Safari over IE.
Another hidden gem I found on the Mac post-purchase was the .Mac service from Apple .
At $ 99 a year , it certainly is n't the cheapest hosting/e-mail service around .
However , it is much more than that .
For a novice who wants to put up a web page , I mean a TRUE NOVICE , there is better solution .
For example , areas where text be added only allow the user to put in their own text move on .
I you make minor changes , such as text color size , but that 's it .
Experienced web designers will find the .Mac templates to be far too simple inflexible .
However , novices will get a big grin on how easy it is how they ca n't mess things up .
Speaking of photos , the .Mac service seamlessly works with iPhoto in what has to be one of the greatest feats of integration I have ever seen on a personal computer...and it works !
Let 's say you have taken pictures with your digital camera imported them into iPhoto .
Now you want to put some of those pictures on the website you created through the .Mac service .
All you need to do is launch iPhoto select the photos ( by clicking on them ) you want to put on your website .
Once you select them , you simply click on the "homepage " icon on the bottom of iPhoto window .
This brings up a window which shows what your web page , complete with the photos , will look like .
It also adds a title of the page , which you overwrite , as well as an area where you write a description of the event related to the photos on the page .
only does it automatically publish the page , but it also adds a link to that photo page on your home page !
You then go back to your homepage in .Mac edit the text for that link .
Down the road when you want to delete the photo page , you simply login to .Mac it shows you a list of the pages on your site .
In other words , you do n't need to worry about the impact that changing eliminating one page has on another page .
In fact , you do n't need to know the first thing about designing a website .
iPhoto combined with the .Mac service makes it easy for ANYONE to put up their own website .
I ca n't stress enough how easy it is .
Also , it gives you the option of password-protecting the site , which is a nice feature in this day age .
The .Mac service also offers integration with iMovie for posting movie clips to your site , although I have investigated that yet .
In addition , you get all sorts of free software special offers ( that are actually worthwhile ) through .Mac.
The .Mac service also offers all sorts of online training for many applications , such as the iLife applications .
The other " services " it offers are e-mail , server space for backup , as well as an interesting way to backup allow you to access your bookmarks , calendar , contacts files over the internet .
This is where your website backup files are located .
iSync automatically synchronizes information such as your calendar , contacts , bookmarks files between your hard drive your iDisk makes them available to you over the internet through any web browser on any computer (PC Mac ) .
iSync also performs various synchronization feats between your iMac other Macs , as well as with Palm PDA 's bluetooth mobile phones .
Once you get an understanding of how .Mac integrates with your iMac , all the services it offers , $ 99 like a relative bargain .
I am very glad I have the .Mac service .
I also note that more experienced website designers upload their designs to the .Mac web server they the .Mac templates are too simplistic .

Apple provides complimentary phone for 90 days from the date of purchase .
Since I was new to the Mac world , I purchased 3 years of for $ 169 ( called the AppleCare Protection Plan ) .
My was that since I was new to the platform , I 'd need the more than the average person .
Well , I have n't called yet !
I 'm almost hoping I will have a minor issue just to get some sort of payback on my investment !
It also includes onsite service versus having to send it - drive it - back to an Apple authorized service center ( which is the case with the standard 1 year warranty ) .
I do n't understand why many people say Apple 's are more expensive than PC 's .
When I was shopping , I found that the PC 's from Dell Gateway were MORE expensive for a similarly equipped computer .
I paid $ 1799 for my 17 " 1Ghz iMac.

SUMMARY
It has been the most satisfying consumer electronics purchase I have ever made ...period .
It is beautiful .
It is easy to use .
It is fun .
What more I ask for ?
Once you sit down use the Mac , you will see that the whole is much more than just the sum of its parts .
You 'll forget all about processor speeds , caches different types of RAM.
Rather , you 'll just enjoy the experience of using your computer .
Since Windows is pretty much universal on PC 's , PC purchases usually boil down to how much hardware you are getting for your dollar .
Sure , you have your hardcore Mac fans who spend countless hours debating how fast something will get done on a Mac G4 versus G5 .
But for the average consumer who just wants to their computer to work effortlessly , it really comes down to the software .
it is the software that really makes the Mac shine .
Of course , the fact that it looks so nice is an added bonus !
Since I 've before owned a " cutting edge " computer , always choosing to buy machines that were near their "end-of-life , " I decided to take a chance on the hottest of the hot , the Dual 2GHz G5 .
So , I ordered one .
waited .
waited .
waited some more .
Apple had to re-authorize the charge on my card twice before I received a nice e-mail that included the FedEx tracking number .
Then I spent another week waiting , checking the FedEx tracking website for progress , making sure someone was here to receive the package when it arrived .
Even the box it arrived in screams , " I 'm stylish , I 'm beautiful , GOOD GRIEF I'M FAST. "
Opening the black cardboard box reveals a sheet of cardboard over the accessories , including the keyboard mouse , a phone cord , a USB extension cable ( nice touch , Apple ! ) for those who 'd like their keyboard to be a bit farther from the machine , the power cable .
The case is made of plain matte-finished aluminum with an Apple logo embossed very lightly in a different texture .
Unless you have the light just right , you wo n't even see it .
All of the seams meet perfectly , I found irregularities at all .
Setting the computer up was a snap .
Turning the machine on , I heard the familiar Apple chord , it started right up .
Seeing a welcome screen in several languages , I proceeded to fill in the little forms to register the machine ...
It 's *fast* .
I rip entire CDs to MP3 in approximately four minutes , according to the CPU Monitor I 'm even maxing out the processors .
The Box , " What 's With the Giant Cheese Grater On Your Desk ? "
More than one reviewer has that the G5 with its front back surfaces covered in holes looks like a giant cheese grater .
I do n't see that close a resemblance , myself - it looks more like a speaker grille to me .
There are so many holes in the case that I understand the actual surface area to be reduced by about 35 % - 65 % of it is aluminum , the front back are 35 % holes .
The gorgeous aluminum case for the G5 houses three available PCI-X slots , the AGP slot , dual processors , a SuperDrive ( DVD-R , CD-R , etc. , all in one unit ) a 160GB hard drive .
The back panel includes ports for USB 2.0, FireWire 400 , FireWire 800 , optical digital audio in out , analog audio in out , Gigabit Ethernet , a phone port for the modem , two little connectors for internal Bluetooth Airport Extreme .
( Bluetooth is only available as a build-to-order option , be added internally post-purchase . )
Also on the back panel is the latch to open the case - which is padlockable .
Much more effective than the Kensington " security slot , " I 'm sure .
The front panel has the power switch , a headphone jack , USB 2.0 FireWire 400 ports .
longer do I have to reach around the back of a machine USB hub to plug in my CompactFlash card reader to download pictures from the digital camera .
do I have to fumble around trying to connect a FireWire cable behind the machine to capture video .
The Fans , " The Sounds of Near-Silence "
The Power Macintosh G5 has multiple " cooling zones " inside the machine .
They 're designed so that air move from the front of the machine to the back out in a "laminar " flow .
This means reduced turbulence inside the machine , resulting in better airflow - quiet .
You remove the aluminum side panel to look inside the box while it 's still running , but you remove the clear plastic air deflector , the machine will automatically go to sleep so that it does n't overheat .
I 've heard stories from other people who say that the fans will cycle up down , get very loud - I set the machine to "fastest , " the fans stay on all the time , the box is still quieter than my old Dual G4 was ( it was n't a WindTunnel/Mirrored Door Mac , ! )
Even the SuperDrive spinning up to rip a CD to MP3 is louder than the fans are .
Music , " I Paid $ 3000 For A 3" Radio Shack Speaker ? ! ? "
Additionally , the G5 longer supports the Apple Pro Speaker connector , so I ca n't use the Griffin ProSpeaker Cable to connect speakers to the machine .
On the other hand , the optical digital audio out port means I plug the G5 directly into a Dolby 5.1 Surround Sound amplifier receiver , have more audio wattage than I know what to do with .
The analog audio-out port is also available to plug in a regular set of powered speakers .
The two connectors are the ADC , Apple Desktop Connector , which supports Apple monitors with built-in USB hubs , a DVI connector for other industry-standard LCD flat panel screens .
The ADC connector itself supports the power USB signal to the monitor , while the DVI connector provides nothing but video signal .
Apple thoughtfully includes a DVI-to-VGA adapter in the box so one connect a non-DVI flat panel screen ( like the Samsung 171S) , as well as regular HD-15 VGA monitors .
Expansion Slots , " What Do I Do With My Old Keyspan SX Pro Serial Card ? "
The PCI-X slots in the G5 only 3.3v signaling .
This means that a rather significant number of PCI cards will even fit into the slot , let alone function .
So , I need to upgrade from the old Keyspan SX Pro to a four-port USB-to-Serial adapter in order to connect my other machines ' console cables .
There are eight memory slots in the G5 , two of which are occupied when you buy it .
This does n't even come close to the maximum RAM addressable by the processor .
There 's one extra slot inside the machine for an additional Serial ATA hard drive .
That 's right - only two slots for hard drives .
But since Serial ATA drives come in flavors up to 200GB more , do you really need that much storage space ?
The Goodies , " ANOTHER One-Button Mouse ! "
It is , unfortunately , yet another clear-bodied "one-button " Apple Optical Mouse .
I even unwrapped the mouse , opting to install my Kensington Turbo Pro Trackball Nostromo SpeedPad n50 as my input devices .
( Bonus : The Nostromo driver longer kernel panics the machine ! )
Software Compatibility , " The Upgrade Race "
So far , I 've been lucky .
I have yet to find any of my current software rendered useless by moving to the G5 .
Virtual PC , on the other hand , is something that a number of my friends acquaintances depend on for specific applications .
The G5 simply wo n't run it - yet .
( Knock on wood ) I have n't even managed to crash this one yet .
Mac OS X 10.2.8 ( G5 ) is the most stable iteration I 've seen yet .
Speed - Enough Said
In the course of writing this review , I 've also ripped another 13 CDs to MP3 , dumping them into the iTunes library .
While ripping CDs , I 've also been using iChat AV to talk to a friend of mine (using the iSight FireWire camera - a slick little piece of hardware ! ) writing at the same time .
It 's fast

There are ( 2 ) USB 2.0 Ports in front for easy access , plus six more in the back , providing plenty of room for USB accessories .

you add a wireless combo , they do send these .

This leaves ( 2 ) PCI slots for accessories .

Software :
Dell installs many " system utilities " which degrade system performance waste hard disk space .
The typical end user will have the technical expertise to disable all of the unnecessary services , disable remove all of the Dell Spyware Dell related Software that deteriorates System performance significantly , the Shareware that become non-functional after 30 days from the date of first use .
Because of this , I highly recommend removing hard drive partitions ( erasing all software ) then re-installing the software from the provided CD-ROMs.
Dell provides a System Restore CD which removes the drive partition re-images the drive with a standard Dell setup / configuration , much as the Symantec software Ghost do .
This reloads all of the Dell Spyware utilities that slow the computer down .
Dell also includes the Operating System CD , in my case , Windows XP home .
You setup your system from scratch by placing this CD in the CD-ROM drive restarting your system .
This allows one to setup XP , you remove the drive partition( s ) before proceeding with setup .

System Setup :
Besides the problems listed under Software , above , all three of our systems had a Thirty Seven Megabyte FAT partition installed in addition to the Windows XP NTFS Partition .
this is installed to allow for System Hibernation with Power Savings .
I recommend deleting this partition using One ( two , depending on your technical abilities preferences ) partitions formatted with NTFS.
Turning your computer off is more energy effective , you do have any problems that be associated with system Hibernation .

The stay-cool ( they do stay cool on the stove top ) handles are double-riveted to the sides of each piece , as are handles on the lids , each piece ( pot , skillet pan -- any piece that rest on a heat source ) is of three-ply construction : a core of aluminum ( to conduct even , lasting heat ) coated on both sides by polished stainless steel for beauty , ease of cleaning non-reactivity with all foods .
Everything about this cookware says " solid " .
the lids ( one for each pot pan for the 10 " skillet in this set ) are made of solid stainless steel , too .
Great stuff , All-Clad .
when you lift a piece of it , you 'll know it .
The long , angled handles of the All-Clad sauce pan sauté pan balance perfectly with the weight of the pans themselves .
This means they have good "heft " .
I 'll vouch for that .
My Revereware had heft , at the most , unmeasurable heft -- meaning that anytime I filled a pot with food , I had to do some work to hold the pot at the right angle to keep from spilling it when moving from the stove to the table counter .
I get enough strength in my forearms to cart food-laden vessels with handles around the kitchen clutching the handle with two hands gripping the other side of the pot none-too-gracefully .
Large pieces , like the 3-quart sauté pan offer a loop handle opposite the long handle , for carrying convenience .
Nice touch , very helpful , especially when pouring sauce from the pan to a platter bowl .

Time Kitchen Tested Guilty-Pleasure-Enjoying Mom Approved .
~~Saturday Scramblette~ ~
Serves 4-6
roll sausage , browned drained
oil
4 medium russet potatoes , washed cubed
1 medium onion , chopped
2 cloves garlic , minced
1/2 green pepper , chopped ( optional )
1/2 - 1 c.
water
1-1/2 c. grated cheddar cheese
8 eggs , beaten
Heat the All-Clad 3-quart Sauté Pan over medium-high flame .
Add sausage brown , breaking it into bite-sized pieces .
Drain fat remove sausage to side bowl .
Add potatoes to the skillet with the oil , browning lightly on all sides .
Salt pepper to taste .
Just before finished , add onion sauté with potatoes .
Add garlic pepper ( opt. ) , sauté until tender .
Add enough water to make ingredients moist .
Cover reduce heat to cook potatoes through scorching ( medium to low ) .
Add salt pepper to taste .
Fold eggs cheese into the mixture continue to fold until eggs are set .
Serve hot with toast , biscuits bagels .
Excellent reheated .

Here is why this is an excellent line some things that prevent it from being perfect .
The interior is a high polish interior ( read : very shiny , almost mirror-like ) .
The handles are riveted on so they are much sturdier than they had been electro-welded on ( this is how handles on most pots are affixed ) .
The copper bottom allows for even heat distribution across the bottom of the pot .
Copper also heats up very quickly .
The pot is also a decent weight , it 's durable but too heavy to use .
There are many things that seriously need to be improved on this pot .
The lid be a little more tight-fitting , in my opinion a little bit too much steam ( heat ) is able to escape .
The handles , which are all metal , have gotten very hot in my experience but they do become warm so these are n't the best pots for young children to learn how to cook with .
I have preferred a " capped " bottom ( when the conductive metal , aluminum copper is sandwiched between the stainless steel pot a stainless steel " cap" ) but that I my preference is a personal one , I do n't it have done anything to improve the pot .
Cleaning this pot is super easy but I warn people to take care to overfill the pot .
the food level goes above the rivets for the handles , it become harder to clean around the rivets .

Let me start by making two things very clear .
I LOVE POPCORN I LOVE MY WHIRLEY POPCORN POPPER !
OK , I bought this popper about six months ago it was love at first batch .
This popcorn is GOOD !
It's so easy to make great popcorn with this popper .
you follow the simple directions that are included , you'll make flawless popcorn every time you use this popper .
That's right , more burnt popcorn almost more un-popped kernels .
This is a very high heat popper .
It's made of thin aluminum that conducts quickly .
The lid has four small incisions that allow steam to escape during popping .
This keeps the popcorn crisp prevents it from becoming too chewy .
During popping , this baby really gets hot it be used by children who have reached their teen years ( in my opinion ) .
There is a wooden for holding the popper it stays pretty cool at all times .
There are two small wooden knobs on each side of the lid that also stay pretty cool .
Now the thing that really helps this popper make great popcorn is the hand turned paddle .
At the end of the wooden pot handle there's a metal crank that has a small wooden knob on it .
When the first kernels of popcorn begin to pop , you have to slowly turn this crank .
This crank turns a gear driven , wire paddle inside of the popper .
The wire paddle ( wand ) keeps the popcorn moving prevents it from sticking to the bottom of the popper .
This prevents the popcorn from burning it gets ever kernel to contact the bottom pop .
It's really a very simple but effective mechanism .
There are several different methods of popping but a standard method is to put the oil in the popper then get it hot before adding the popcorn kernels .
The amount kind of oil to use is strictly dependant upon personal taste preference .
I have found a place locally that sells pre-packaged corn popping oil that works beautifully with this popper it 's delicious .
Corn popped in this popper is much better than microwave popcorn .
It's less greasy , preservatives , much healthier .
Pop up a batch , light up the big screen , pop in a good movie , it 's show time !
Oh , I forgot the Miller Light .
Can't forget that .
Clean up is very easy .
The popper lid snaps off the paddle comes out when the lid is removed .
One very minor thing to watch out for is ; you use a fair amount of oil to pop , very tiny droplets of hot oil do escape through the lid they sting your hand while you're turning the crank .
A cooking mitt some kind of hand protection be good , especially for anyone who has sensitive skin .

Have you ever bitten into a gritty piece of lettuce in your salad ?
I 've discovered the absolute BEST way to clean your greens keep them hydrated , crisp fresh .
Let me introduce you to the OXO Pump Action Salad Spinner .
~ What is it How Does it Work ?
To use , rinse your greens under cold running water , then place them in the basket .
Put the basket containing the greens into the clear plastic bowl .
Put the pump action lid on top to cover the bowl .
The pump top has a simple locking tab that keeps the push-down pump compressed flush to the lid for storage .
It 's very easy to do .
The pumper then pops up extends above the lid about 3" so .
Then just push down on the pumper .
The basket inside the bowl spins , water is extracted from the greens out of the basket , away from the greens , out into the bowl .
Push the pumper down a few times to keep it spinning allow the centrifugal force to extract the water .
You do n't need to push more than maybe four to six times , but trust me , you 'll keep pushing because it 's so much fun !
Just press the black rubber brake button to stop the spinning .
The bottom of the bowl has a non-skid surface , which helps to keep the bowl steady as the basket spins .
You use this on any convenient surface .
After you 're done playing - er , I mean cleaning your greens , take out the basket with the greens empty out all the water from the bowl that was extracted from your greens .
, you 'd like you even store the greens right in the Salad Spinner bowl .
The Salad Spinner is easy to clean .
The plastic bowl is top-rack dishwasher safe , but since it primarily only has water in it , I just rinse dry .
The whole unit it light weight , uses electricity batteries .
~ My Experience , Tips , Other Notes
I 've found that a full head of iceberg lettuce be broken into wedges , in half , depending on the size of the head , before it will fit into the basket .
of course to adequately wash rinse a head of lettuce it 's best to break it up anyway .
You rinse your lettuce , then fill the Salad Spinner bowl with water let it soak for a little bit .
Then rinse again , place the greens into the basket spin .
This will really get your greens super clean , very hydrated , after chilling they will be crisp delicious .

Lodge is celebrating 100 years of making pans cast from iron .
They even have a special cookbook to go with the Lodge pans which is available at the web site .
Lodge makes the entire pan in a cast ( mold ) which is where the cast name comes from , the pan is made out of iron .
Why you care about a pan being a cast iron ?
Pieces come off .
The finish flakes off .
That does n't happen with a pan cast in one solid piece made of iron .
As for the iron--iron has been used for centuries in cooking .
It holds up to the heat it absorbs the heat cooks evenly .
It is a smooth finish like most pans .
It has pores which absorb oil ( which means these pans get better over time ) .
Also the iron gets in the food ( faint traces ) .
This is fine actually a good thing , since we all need iron in our diet .
Lodge makes a variety of sizes from the tiny one you see in the product to picture up to the large size in the picture .
I do like the small size for meling butter for popcorn for frying onions to go on a sandwich .
Lodge also has the cookbook plus items like covers for the pans ( though I just use a regular lid ) .
They have other kinds of pans like a wok Dutch oven .
In other words this pan is almost 2 feet across .
Since cast iron is heavy , this pan weighs in at 27 pounds then more when filled with food .
The small size is nice .
I have to cook those kinds of quantities , then I use a stew pot make soup stew something like that .
For a large skillet meal , I 'd go with a lighter weight cookware product .
Note that you see a price of $ 5 to $ 35.
Well , that jumbo Lodge runs almost $ 160 .
But this model number is the big pan , I use that order number unless you really do want this really large pan .
Even then I do n't you hire many people who really handle 27 pounds of pan .
only is it hard to move the pan around to cook , it is really hard to wash such a large heavy pan .
Do n't give up on cast iron based on this pan .
Check out my review others on other Lodge pans .
You rub that in then heat the pan on 200 degrees for a couple of hours .

To start with you want to build up the oil base .
Then you cook most anything in the cast iron .
Tomato based products tend to break down the seasoning , but other items are fine .

a pan does rust , then just use a brillo pad rub down .
Then reseason .

Why is this All-Clad sauce pan so good ?
First , the construction of the All-Clad Stainless 1-Quart Sauce Pan is top quality .
The heat conducting metal , aluminum , is at the core of each pan .
This makes a three-layer , bonded piece of cookware that heats quickly , holds the heat , cooks evenly , looks fantastic while doing it .
the part that is n't to heat -- the stay-cool handle -- does n't get hot , unless you use the All-Clad Stainless 1-Quart Sauce Pan in the oven .
A short summary of the All-Clad Stainless 1-Quart Sauce Pan :
, aluminum core for excellent heat conducting purposes
, stainless steel surrounding the aluminum core (3-ply construction )
, stay-cool handle
, oven-safe
, energy-saving ( requires lower heat throughout cooking than does other pans )
, All-Clad lifetime warranty covering manufacturer 's defects
What you do n't get with this All-Clad Stainless 1-Quart Sauce Pan
, a lid ( Usually All-Clad saucepans come with a lid .
Lids are available separately for about $ 25.)
, scorching food , unless left on too high heat for too long
, "hot spots " in the pan that burn scorch
, difficult clean-up . . .
very little elbow grease required

WILDERNESS LODGE IS A FABULOUS PLACE TO STAY AT ON YOUR DISNEY WORLD VACATION.
Now , to expound on that a bit more ....
***RESORT LOBBY , RESTAURANTS , AMENITIES***
The " Disney magic " is abundantly felt seen in this huge log cabin of a resort , a resort made up in the style of old American Northwest Woods cabin .
you 're already in awe at the sight of this impressive building , you 're really in for a treat once you walk through the front doors into the enormous , open lobby .
In the background , playing fairly lightly are tunes from various western films such as Dances With Wolves , which you 've heard the songs from it , are beautiful tranquil to listen to .
Off to the right as you walk into the building is the Service Desk , where resort employees are available at all times to offer prompt courteous service .
I have to give credit to the help , since we made use of them several times they came off as being bothered by your questions were genuinely interested in helping you .
That be a pretty small thing for some people , but that small thing adds to the overall charm appeal of WL.
Within the main lobby are several small sitting places with comfortable chairs sofas .
We took advantage of these numerous times so we all play cards .
It was convenient , we managed to be friendly with the other guests who usually stopped by out of curiosity to see what we were doing .
To the left going down the ramp are the resorts main eating establishments , Artist Point ( the fancier , more expensive dinner-only restaurant which serves American cuisine requires you to make advance reservations ) , Whispering Canyon Cafe ( the more moderately priced family restaurant serving all three meals occasionally has a visit by a Disney character during breakfast ) , The Roaring Forks snack bar ( a quick easy counter-service area that serves up light snacks meal items any time of the day ) .
you do n't make the turn down to the Roaring Forks continue outside , you 're in the pool area of the resort .
The main pool is heated , but on the small side .
There 's also a kiddie pool 2 hot tubs for you to use when crowded already .
There 's a path that leads out to the dock where you take the ferry to the Magic Kingdom over to Fort Wilderness .
Set among a number of weeping willow trees , walking along here adds to the rustic of the atmosphere felt all over the Wilderness Lodge Resort .
you 're back in the lobby facing the Service Desk , there 's another walkway to the left of it , leading to , among other things , the bus stop from which you make your way to the theme parks , other resorts , anything else within Disney property .
Also , along this way is the resort arcade , containing a number of video games for the children , the Wilderness Lodge Mercantile , a general store of sorts from which you purchase snacks , shirts , toys , personal supplies .
( QUICK TIP ) - I found on my last visit that some of the same snack items be found both in the Roaring Forks eatery as well as in the Wilderness Lodge Mercantile , in some cases cheaper in one of these spots the other .
***ROOMS***
My only real complaint about the room is that it was pretty small with few extras for the price we were paying for it per day .
Also , the beds take up most of the width of the room the corners of the beds only come up so far so that it 's really easy to bump your shin on it while walking through the room .
There 's also a small balcony depending on what you 're willing to pay for the room , you get a view of the woods that hide the resort from the road , you get a beautiful view overlooking the pool area Bay Lake .
I prefer this view only for the nightly view of the Electric Water Pageant that makes its way around the lake displaying some brightly colored light pictures while music plays .
***ROOM RATES***
There are 4 main time periods , seasons , during which the room rates vary .
Disney calls them " Value" , " Peak" , " Regular" , " Holiday " time .
me , you want to be sure of which time period your vacation falls into because you be paying ( according to 2002 prices ) $ 194 per night upwards of $ 309 .
There are a number of Internet websites , including Disney 's own , that will give you the exact time frame for each season some that provide you instructions for calling getting some pretty good discounts on resort rooms .
For example , check out www.mousesavers.com
you 'll see what I mean .
***TRANSPORTATION***
As mentioned earlier , there 's a dock for the ferry there 's a bus-stop in front of the resort .
These are the main two means of getting to whereever you wish to go in Disney World .
The ferry ride is very relaxing , especially on a beautifully sunny , cloudless day , when going to coming from a day at the Magic Kingdom .
I had a minor complaint on the last visit with the buses quite being on time .
I on several occasions we ended up waiting there nearly 30 minutes which is pretty aggravating for those already impatient in wanting to get to the parks on those rides .

This was one of those times I definitely enjoyed it .
Whisk Me Away to a Wonderful Room
The room was large rectangular with a big , luscious king-size bed .

The armoire held a 25 inch television there was a writing desk , as well as two upholstered chairs .
My room had two large windows that were draped in softly muted colors .
I found myself wishing that my master bedroom at home was as large comfortably furnished .
A Great Bathroom
Next on my list to explore was the bathroom .
The Italian marble sparkled large , fluffy towels awaited me .

At times like this I really wish I was a bath person , of a shower person .
I have enjoyed soaking in a hot bubbly tub admiring the beautiful surroundings .
Plenty of Extras
There was a nice large closet , complete with two terry bathrobes , ironing board iron , as well as extra pillows blankets .
I be for anything in the room .
The Overall Elegance
After admiring my room finally unpacking , it was time for me to get ready for dinner .

I remember lots of fresh flowers large paintings well-dressed people buzzing about .
I did n't want to dawdle too long , staring like a country girl come to town for the first time .

Dinner for 10 , Please
We had a fairly large party ( about 10 of us ) so we were seated at a long table .
The service was excellent the dinner had been pre-arranged for us with a choice of chicken beef .

Pass the butter , please !

Ah , Room Service !

My breakfast was promptly courteously served most definitely enjoyed .
Meeting Facilities
The hotel accommodate several fairly large meetings in the banquet area .
Our meeting was held in a large high-ceilinged ballroom , with lovely chandeliers throughout the room .

Very Nice Overall Experience

I checked into the Sheraton Yankee Clipper Hotel in early December '02 .
My accommodations were in the beach tower ; in order to get to them , I had to go back outside walk through the parking area .
I had a standard ocean view room with typical Sheraton amenities including a king sized bed , 20 inch color TV with cable , computer hook-up , a decent sized bathroom plenty of complementary toiletries .
The clean bath towels provided by the hotel were rough , thin small .
The pillows on the bed were old flat .
I had to request extra pillows , even the ones brought to the room were just as as bad .
All hotel towels were the same quality ; although I had lots of extras , they were all thin worn .
All the beds I checked out to be on a concrete platform .
Some people , including my husband , prefer this arrangement .
However , it was too stiff for me to ever comfortable .
The hotel was situated in a fairly good location .
The wide stretch of beach along Fort Lauderdale 's waterfront was spectacular .
Unfortunately , the lounge chairs umbrellas on the beach were owned by a concession who charged $ 15/day .
I refused to pay this amount to enjoy a few hours in the sun .
But most people I spoke to paid to do so , as the hotel 's pool areas ( two of them ) consisted of a square pool , concrete decking few lounge chairs some tables with umbrellas chairs .
Considering my employer paid a corporate rate ( $ $ $ ) , I have for the money , this hotel have been typical of other Sheraton resorts elsewhere .
There was a restaurant on the premises , which always empty , a quiet lounge with happy hour munchies ( bad ) entertainment ( at least when I was there ) .
The vast majority of clientele , from what I tell , were foreign visitors on holiday airline employees staying the night .
Some of the people I ran into on Sunday night were there as part of a pre-cruise package .
way , it , most people used this hotel only to sleep to freshen-up by night go elsewhere for entertainment by day .
Other hotels in the area had landscaped pool areas where clientele spent more time enjoying the facilities .
One other couple I had met who arranged to stay here with a cruise line said they paid $ 90/night .
there was one positive aspect , it was the hotel 's location .
Across the street at the Bahia Mar Hotel , is the water taxi stop .
For a few bucks , you take the water taxi to excellent restaurants , shopping points of interest tour the mansions of Fort Lauderdale along the water ways while in transit .
I found it enjoyable during the day as well as at night .
The beach front by the hotel also offers the best beach volleyball in Fort Lauderdale ; good competition you play fun to watch you do n't .
There are good restaurants a short walk away , public transportation that picks you up drops you off at the front of the hotel .
Cab fare to from the airport Port Everglades was around $ 12 including tip .
.

Disney 's Beach Club resort is truly beautiful , relaxing , perfectly situated .
The pool , called Stormalong Bay ( shared by both resorts ) is the Beach Club 's jewel , the element that keeps families coming back : it 's huge , with lots of nooks crannies bridges , a sand-covered bottom of typical concrete , a big water slide .
You spend days hanging around these sister resorts run out of things to do !
Dining
Directly across from the Yacht Beach Club is the Boardwalk resort , which is just a 5-minute walk away , there are tons of dining entertainment options over there ( the Boardwalk looks beautiful all lit up at night , you 've got a lagoon view room ) .
The dining choices at the Yacht and Beach Club are n't shabby , : Cape Cafe offers a character buffet breakfast in the morning a non-character ( but delicious ) clambake buffet at night , with menu items such as clam chowder , fresh clams , corn on the cob , new potatoes , chicken , rice , salad bar , the most scrumptious dessert bar in WDW ( to mention a kid 's section with fried shrimp , chicken tenders , etc. ) .
Hurricane Hannah 's is a snack bar by the pool where you find burgers , tuna sandwiches , etc . drinks ( alcoholic non ) to eat on the patio take back to your poolside chair .
A full 24-hour room service menu is available .
Accommodations
Guest rooms are spacious comfortable : two queen-sized beds , large bathroom with two outside sinks , a table with two chairs , a couch that serves as a bed , TV , mini-bar in every room .
Housekeeping does a great job of keeping your room beautiful .
Most rooms have balconies , but some upper-floor rooms only have tiny balconies which barely hold 2 people standing upright--if you want a full balcony with chairs , you definitely request one when you 're making reservations , then again ( by fax phone ) a few days before you check in .
My only Beach Club room complaint is that there is very little storage space for clothes--only a few large drawers , a standing chest of small drawers , very much closet space/hangers .
Transportation
Transportation is pretty darned good at this non-monorail resort : 10-minute boat launch to Disney Studios , bus service to the Magic Kingdom Animal Kingdom , you take a scenic walk to EPCOT Center ( entering through the World Showcase ...only a 5-minute walk , that .
; ) ) You also take a boat launch to EPCOT.
Overall , Disney 's Beach Club knows how to make a good time for the whole family--anyone staying at the Yacht and Beach Club has so many options just a few steps away .

I stayed at Treasure Island in Las Vegas in late 2001 .
Of my four trips to Vegas , this was my best hotel experience yet .
Treasure Island is excellent for a number of reasons , with location being a top bonus .
Treasure Island's location allows easy access to the strip , the convenient tram to the Mirage saves time sun exposure .
One of my favorite things about the hotel is that it is very easy to get from the front entrance to the guest elevators .
In other hotels , with NYNY MGM being prime examples , the guest elevators are obscured in the midst of the casino .
At Treasure Island , it is a straight shot from the door to the guest elevators .
The Room
Treasure Island boasts its spectacular views of the Pirate Battle the volcano at the Mirage .
Well , we checked in had a view of a roof .
Ok , so it was n't quite the Pirate Battle , but how many times did we look out the window during the weekend ?
About three;and only to make sure the sun was still shining .
The room was a standard size , with two queen beds , a table chairs , a TV cabinet There were two mirrored closets , a roomy bathroom with a large tub .
The beds were comfortable , everything in the room was in good condition .
We had enough room to store all of our luggage tripping over it , we found enough outlets for our hairdryers , curling irons , immersion heaters , nightlights , etc .
Amenities
Even so , it was still nice for a relaxing afternoon swim .
Treasure Island has one main pool , a smaller children's pool , a large hot tub .
Lounge chairs , cabanas , poolside service are readily available .
My main complaint about the pool is that to get to it , guests walk through the main part of the hotel shopping area , right past the Mystere theatre .
That is the most comfortable stroll to take when you are dripping wet unkempt .
I did try any of the spa services offered at Treasure Island , but they had a nice selection of massages , facials , manicures , etc . available for guests .
Dining
Treasure Island has several restaurants to choose from .
For casual all-day dining , there is the Terrace Café .
The café features a standard menu of American meals snacks .
In addition to a number of other casual cafés snack bars , Treasure Island has several fine-dining establishments .
The Buccaneer Bay restaurant offers a gourmet menu private view of the pirate battle .
For any of the restaurants , it is important to consider reservations and/or waiting time .
The Terrace Café in particular is very busy .
The Pirate Battle at Treasure Island is always an interesting event .
Overall
While it be the newest most spectacular , Treasure Island has nearly as much to offer as the other strip hotels .
It is a great 'home base ' for your trip to Vegas .
A little note of interest to those concerned about safety
Late on Sunday afternoon as I was napping , I was jolted awake by the sound of an alarm .
A calm voice said something to the effect of This is the early warning fire alarm system .
Please review the safety instructions in your guest manual .
We will update you after further investigation ' I quickly dressed gathered easy-to-carry valuables , then stood by the map of my fire escape route awaiting further instruction .
I did n't smell smoke see flames , but heard sirens coming toward the hotel .
After about ten minutes , an all-clear was announced , everything went back to normal .
I have to admit I was impressed by the hotel's fire preparedness .
Imagine evacuating a giant hotel/casino clear instructions .
It is with considerable trepidation that I commence on a review of the Benson Hotel that refutes tombarnes ' excellent review of this same property .
Still , one of the hallmarks of a really good hotel is consistency of service , while I 'm willing to concede that my review is based on a sample size of only one , I my conclusions are nevertheless valid .
my is this : you wo n't find me staying at The Benson again .
As a native Portlander , I have of course always been aware of this place , with its distinctive architecture , prime location , ridiculously liveried doormen .
Most locals hesitate to name The Benson Hotel as the luxury lodging in town .
It 's a favorite for wedding nights , prom nights , anniversaries , for sleazy but high-dollar office liaisons too .
For my money , however , regardless of your intent , you do better than The Benson .
The hotel :
Built in 1912 by local timber baron Simon Benson , the hotel lobby displays all the style excess of the boom era in which it was built .
The lobby features beautiful wood paneling , ornate finish work , a chummy bar area .
Chandeliers , marble floors , a grand piano add to the elegance of the space .
Unfortunately ( this is by means a phenomenon limited to The Benson ) , the lobby also features hoardes of slack-jawed gawkers , at least half of whom are wearing bermuda shorts talking too loudly .
The room is n't especially large , the hubbub of traffic makes it a less dignified special place than the decor .
I this is a vestigial reminder of the hotel's boom days , when smoking was a far more prevalent practice .
Every table in the lobby holds an ashtray , despite olfactory evidence that anyone has actually smoked in that room since Simon Benson his buddies sparked up their Havanas at the hotel's gala opening .
Best I tell , the rack rate for rooms at The Benson range from around $ 200 to well over $ 500 per night .
When we checked in , the desk clerk offered us our choice of a smoking room with a king-sized bed a non-smoking room with two double beds .
I realize that Priceline makes guarantees regarding the room , but my usual experience is that the hotel will do its best to accommodate visitor preferences .
Our choices were offered in such a desultory , offhand , "take it leave it " fashion that I got peeved loudly that we indeed leave it find lodging elsewhere .
Our room :
Upon entering the elevator , we experienced a momentary burst of enthusiasm when we realized that our 12th floor room was at the top of the hotel , with only the astronomically-priced penthouse suites above us .
Upon entering our room , however , all thoughts of luxury and/or panoramic views fled .
Our room was , uh , cozy , particularly given the large footprint of two double beds .
However , any consideration of the room its amenities was completely overshadowed by the view , which was spectacularly bad - indeed , I do n't know that I 've ever experienced a worse one .
you want to experience our view , step outside , stand in a parking lot , bend 90 degrees at the waist focus intently on the view at your feet - that 's what we saw ( minus your feet , of course ) .
Our windows looked about 30 feet directly across an interior airwell to an absolutely featureless concrete wall .
The scary part , of course , is that we were near the very top of the building , benefited from at least a little light from the sky - I really pity the poor folks who pay rack rate for a gloomy fourth floor view of the same thing .
For an old building , the room was in adequate , pristine , condition .
Lighting was sketchy at best ... at some point in the evening I tried to find something in the closet , it was only by dumb luck that my flailing arms hit a dangling string that was attached to a bulb in the closet .
Additionally , the desk lamp ( which provided the only light other than the wall switch-controlled bedside lamp ) was inoperable .
The walls fixtures were in decent shape , with trademark beige , white , black window coverings shower curtain ( which I found eerily reminiscent of Yasser Arafat 's headcovering ) , mottled beige walls , a couple of boring pictures , so-so linens .
Amenities included a ludicrously-priced honor bar , two nice terrycloth robes , a two-line phone .
Resident bathroom expert PrfStars reports that that room suffered from the of a fan that the toiletries were only marginal .
of separate shampoo conditioner , The Benson offers a " conditioning shampoo" , which is evidently a bad thing .
Anyway , in addition , a small shelf in the bathroom held a shower cap ( does anyone actually use those anymore ? ) , sewing kit , rosemary-scented body wash ( " Who wants to smell like focaccia ? "
PrfStars ) , of course the obligatory lint-free all-purpose cloth thing .
Oh , a glass jar of cotton balls swabs , which sort of skeeved me , like other people had been fumbling around in the same jar .
The Benson offers nightly turn-down service .
When we returned from dinner , our room had been straightened up , sheets turned down , a couple of chocolates placed on the nightstand .
Nevertheless , it was a nice touch , I guess .
A final , comprehensive gripe :
The most significant impression I got from our stay at The Benson was of rampant utterly unwarranted price gouging .
I have problem with a hotel charging premium prices for unique and/or high quality products .
But when I'm asked to pay three four times the market price for ubiquitous , easily obtainable things , I just exploited .
The rooms are substantially overpriced , at least at the rates that most guests will pay .
Ancillary services , such as parking , honor bar , laundry , business services are equally inflated .
But nowhere is overpricing more evident than in the hotel 's dining options .
Both offer decent , stuffy , food service at prices that make places like The Palm Morton's like a Vegas buffet .
We happily passed on both .
Similarly , the room service menu was so inflated as to be utterly laughable .
That's $ 20.40 for a breakfast that has an intrinsic value of about five bucks .
Include me out .
Wrong .
Well , I mean , we were low-rent Priceline customers , but I do n't that ever be a reason for less than standard service - therefore , I have to conclude that even had we paid full rate , we have received the same service , the same room .
With an abundance of nearby lodging dining alternatives , I don't see any compelling reason to ever visit The Benson Hotel again .
" The Benson Hotel in the heart of downtown Portland , Oregon , provides travelers a truly unique experience among even the most distinct Portland hotels . "
While I intuitively grasp what this tortured sentence is attempting to say , I really wish someone shoot it in the head put it out of my misery .

upgraged us from the hotel room which runs around $ 165 . a night to the
Cabins on the Lake across the road by the Lone Eagle Grill .
These rooms run around $ 345 . a night , charged us the $ 165 .
Hotel Tower rate .
The Hyatt is on the North Shore at Incline village which is so quaint friendly .

The rooms have two bathrooms , a bedroom with a sitting area , a safe , a Fireplace in the living room , color TV in the living room , bedroom even in the main bathroom .
There is a terrace outside the living room area with a wood deck chairs to take in the view of the lake .
I recommend renting a 4 wheel drive vehicle , since it is very mountainous .

castle on the lake .

Where I beg to differ with beerbuff , is you gamble in the Casino at Hyatt at Roulette for a minimum $ 2.00 bet .
There are nickel , dime quarter slots , as well as electronic poker machines .
They have poker tables in the back for the serious gambler .
They have a great breakfast buffet for $ 20. each morning my husband I fill up be hungry until almost dinner time .
Within a 10 minute scenic drive you be at McDonalds for breakfast you prefer when on a budget .
I found you budget your money in advance for food , souvenir 's gambling , you have a great memorable time in Lake Tahoe .
I also recommend joining the Hyatt Gold Passport club , because you also upgrade to the Cabins on the lake with you member points the price drops down to about $ 245 from $ 345 a night .
You accrue , member points , with every stay at any Hyatt .

I have recently returned from my honeymoon .
My husband I chose Disney World for several reasons .
However , we had cable television I remember watching a special on all the different theme hotels at Disney World wishing I stay at all the different hotels .
I had stayed with my family at the Disneyland hotel many times , but that hotel does have a theme .
Our first choice was the Grand Floridian , but since we were paying for the honeymoon ourselves , we opted to stay there after learning that our honeymoon cost about $ 500 more than it we stayed at the Polynesian .
The " Poly " was our second choice .
We chose to stay there because it had a Hawaiian/Polynesian theme that be ( hopefully ) similar to going to Hawaii for a honeymoon .
The Poly is very ideally situated .
It is on the monorail line , so getting to the Magic Kingdom Epcot are very easy .
It is also within walking distance of the Ticket Transportation Center , which provides bus transportation to MGM Studios , Animal Kingdom , Downtown Disney the water parks .
Additionally , bus transportation is also provided directly from the hotel .
The rooms at the Poly are quite large .
A standard room comes with two queen beds a day bed , so two parents three children stay quite comfortably .
I you fit in a baby in a crib in addition to the five people already staying there .
The armoire has 5 drawers so with plenty of space for clothes .
Additionally , there is a large closet with a room safe for storing valuables .
There is also a table , two chairs an ice bucket .
The room décor is very festive .
Island patterned bedspreads about the aforementioned armoire had a faux bamboo design as did the headboard .
While it was more kitschy than authentic , it was still a fun place to stay .
The least expensive is the "garden " room there are also "lagoon " rooms ( with views of the water ) concierge rooms with lots of extra pampering .
We had a garden room-next to the monorail , less .
However , even though the monorail passed right by our patio door , it was so quiet that it did bother us at all .
The Great Ceremonial house is the main building at the Poly .
We got caught in a HUGE rainstorm on Wednesday Steve 's shorts were soaked .
We about buying another pair for him , but the shorts on sale were around $ 40-and they were ugly !
One of our favorite places was the snack bar .
You buy a mug there for $ 10 then get free refills for the duration of your stay .
Considering that a soda costs about $ 1.50 , this is a great cost saver-especially you come back to the hotel for a rest in the middle of the afternoon .
Additional dining options include the Kona Café Ohanas , which we ate at on our first night .
I plan to review the restaurant in a different section , but I assure you , this is a see-even you do n't stay at the Poly .
In short , it is an all-you eat feast featuring meat on sticks .
The cost is $ 22 per person well worth it .
It 's a great place to take kids-we loved our meal there .
In the morning , Ohanas features a character breakfast .
Although we did do this , the Poly also rents little speedboats for about $ 25 for a ½ hour .
They looked like a lot of fun , but we did have time to do this .
I did have a couple of very minor problems about the room .
I do n't know this was a Florida drought thing something else , but it was annoying .
Also , our remote control had batteries , but since we did spend so much time watching television , this did bother us .
The pillows were smaller than normal a little hard , but that was the only thing that bothered me .
As you see , these things are minor .
Also , when we arrived , Steve asked about an room upgrade because it was our honeymoon .
The clerk said that there were rooms available , but he be happy to send something for us over the next day .
We got anything .
Again , since we were going to be getting something for nothing , getting it did n't bother me , but still; .
Overall , staying at the Poly was great .
The Poly is a great place for everyone-honeymooners , couples , families , singles-everyone appreciate the décor everything the Poly has to offer .

However , the experience we had at the Ritz-Carlton Boston was completely uncharacteristic of my other experiences only be summed up by saying it was HORRIBLE.

We loved the location , which is right across the street from the Public Gardens Boston Common .

Friends of ours had stayed in both the old new areas had discouraged us from the newer addition .

The next day we received a phone call from a close friend client of my mother 's , after an awkward few minutes , she asked how we enjoyed the gifts she 'd arranged for us .
I 'm sure she felt rather uncomfortable having to ask us at all , but she it was strange that we 'd mentioned it .
Imagine our surprise when she told us that she was the one who had sent us the flowers !
She had also arranged for a cheese tray with my favorite cheeses to be delivered , a fruit tray , had specified that they be waiting when we arrived since she knew we'd be famished after over 12 hours of flying .
She had also sent a check ahead of time asked the concierge to purchase a gift certificate to Legal Seafood for us to enjoy during our stay had mailed a hand-written note well in advance to be displayed with these wonderful gifts when we arrived .
All of this was paid for in advance with a generous tip included for the concierge .
They apologized , we saw the gift certificate , the hand-written note , the cheese !
The final insult was their response to our friend .
When she called to complain , they lied to her told her that we'd refused the cheese tray delivery had indeed received the gift certificate note , when she told them that she'd spoken to us knew this was n't true , they told her that we were the liars !
She followed up with a letter to their corporate offices , but even that was responded to with a form letter personal addressing to the problems .
She her husband , both frequent , affluent travelers , refuse to stay at any Ritz-Carlton properties since then .
Following our complaints , we received unwelcome glares walking through the lobby , which only served to anger us further .
But the story does n't end there .
you even it , it gets worse .
After a few days of being at the hotel , we awoke one morning to the most awful "smell . "
It took them over an hour to arrive , when the hotel repairman did finally arrive , he told us the Freon from the fridge had leaked some similar problem .
They removed the fridge , which the entire floor of the hotel had complained about , but you know where they put it ?
In a maintenance closet on the same floor !
This was just too much !
We called downstairs again , fully expecting understanding of the problem , asked to be moved to another room .
Simple request , right ?
They told us no!
We were outraged !
We were fully prepared to move to the Four Seasons , but we had only one more night felt it was n't worth the trouble , that we'd simply return to their Boston property again .
I'd also like to comment on the restaurants .
I have complaints about spending money on fine dining , but the food here was overpriced uninspired .
My mother summed it up as mundane at best .

Despite our unfortunate experiences with the concierge , front desk , management , we did have compliments for a few other staff members that did help to brighten our overall dismal stay .
The doormen recognized us chatted with us each day when we'd return from shopping sightseeing , they remembered our names details about us , which was nice .
Since the hotel has the only working , manned elevator today , the elevators have "attendants " to run them , one of them allowed me to work it one night , which was fun .
We also spent an evening in the lounge , this was by far the only true highlight of our experience .
He actually got everybody in the lounge singing together at one point , when the waiter came for our drink order , my mom tried something new on his recommendation was more than satisfied with the concoction he chose .
Besides these few gems , though , it was terrible beyond my worst travel nightmares .
It was little surprise to us when , shortly after our stay , the property was demoted from a five-diamond property .
you want a convenient location , excellent service , fine accommodations , move about one block down to the Four Seasons .
