I 've been to Walt Disney World about nine times since 1985 stayed at the Polynesian Beach Resort most of those times .
The first time was an accident ( it was all that was available ) but each time afterward it was a conscious decision .
I 've talked to numerous people at the resort who told me that , they too were repeat visitors .
Location
In real estate , they say that location is everything .
that 's the case , you ca n't go wrong here your main interest at WDW is the Magic Kingdom .
Like the Contemporary , Grand Floridian Wilderness Lodge , the Polynesian is located across the water from the MK.
Unlike the others , though , you have four options for getting there from the Poly .
You take the monorail from the station within the resort ( about five minutes , depending on timing ) ; take the boat from the Poly marina dock ( about ten minutes , longer the circular route takes you to the Grand Floridian first ) ; walk over to the Ticket Transportation Center take the ferryboat direct monorail .
The last two options sound too appealing , but you 're on the west side of the resort , the walk is less than ten minutes there is a big line at the Poly , you save some time .
More importantly , here 's something few people do n't realize -- by walking to the TTC , you get on a direct monorail to EPCOT save yourself the trip around the lagoon on the resort monorail .
This makes the Polynesian the only resort with direct monorail access to two theme parks .
All over locations within Walt Disney World are accessed by Disney bus ( your car ) .
The standard room at the Polynesian is very large .
There are two Queen sized beds a day bed -- enough space for five adults .
The South Seas theming is carried into the rooms with canopies over the beds , cane furniture appropriate coloured wallpaper paint .
One complaint that I have about the rooms is that there are n't enough power outlets .
I bring a computer , camcorder cellular phone on trips have a hard time plugging everything in putting something in the bathroom ( a good ) .
You connect to AOL with a local call ( 0.75 charge per call ) .
The rooms are spread around the resort in various "longhouses " ( traditional Polynesian structures ) that are three stories high .
Some of the older buildings do have balconies on the second floor .
getting a balcony ( first floor rooms all have patios ) is important to you , be sure to call the resort a couple of days before you arrive to request it .
My personal favourites are Samoa Fiji , both of which are near the main building .
you want to be further away ( quieter ) , the Tahiti is on the far end of the resort ( has a short walk to the TTC. )
All of the rooms have recently been refurbished .
O'Hana
O'Hana , which means "family" , serves two meals .
The food is all you eat , family style is better worse than you 'd find at the local Perkins .
There is also an evening meal ( "feast " ) that consists of appetizers , a salad , all the "skewer served roasted meat " you handle , a pineapple caramel desert .
I 'm of the opinion that the evening meal has declined over the years , while I used to love it , I now generally skip it .
On nights when there are fireworks over the Magic Kingdom , they dim the lights pipe in the music so that you enjoy it from the huge windows that overlook the lagoon MK.
Kona Cafe
This replaced the Coral Island Cafe , which was awful .
too bad for lunch , but do n't go there you are in a hurry .
Captain Cooks
This is a snack bar on the lower level of the main building .
The first night you are there , buy a refillable mug.
You go back to the snack bar for the duration of your stay refill it with soda , lemonade coffee for free .
It 's just convenient .
Amenities
There is plenty to do at the resort that has nothing to do with the theme parks .
You rent paddle mini speed boats , sail boats (you need some sort of proof that you know how to sail to get on those ) to check out the Seven Seas Lagoon Bay Lake .
There are several white sand beachs with chairs umbrellas .
Swimming in the Lagoon is encouraged .
One is currently ( 2/01 ) closed for renovation , is a themed pool (eg : lots of kids ) .
The other is a "quiet pool " is just a big round thing .
Both pools are heated be swum in during the coldest weather .
Once twice the pools have been closed in the evening due to mosquito problems .
Otherwise , they are open all night , but only supervised with lifeguards until about 10pm .
you go to the Great Ceremonial House ( main building ) during the day , there are often activities for children , including Disney movies , colouring singing dancing .
There is a pub small liquor off sale in the main building as well .

Book a garden view room ask when you check in they have any upgrades available .
I 've been bumped up a couple of times .
Rent a car .
The bus system , while efficient , will get you where you need to go as fast as driving yourself .
Do n't forget the short walk to the TTC you want to go to EPCOT.
It will save you a ton of time .
You take the resort monorail back to the Polynesian on your return -- it 's the first stop .
For a quiet evening , grab a couple of drinks go down to the beach about 9pm to watch the Electrical Water Pageant , an underpublicized enjoyable event .
The Neverland Club , like Ohana , has deteriorated a bit over the years , but is still fun for little kids .
This is an expensive resort , doubt about that .
Going during the off season joining the Disney Club will result in some reductions , but it 's still a place to go you 're on a tight budget .
As a first timer , I was extremely excited to see all that it had to offer .
I booked a room at the Riviera through a travel agency doing much research .
All I knew it was that it was cheap on the north end of the strip .
I arrived was disappointed .
because it was a crummy hotel/casino , its a good clean place with an adequate gambling selection , it just did n't have that overwhelming aspect that the other casinos had .
So you are wanting to get the full experience the first time , pay a bit more stay at Treasure Island something in the midst of everything .
The Riviera I is best for those who have been to Vegas before , want to gamble have access to the strip , but do n't want to pay for all the sights they have seen before .
As a side note , do n't waste your money on Crazy Girls , one of their 3 shows , the show is as unimpressive as the hotel the " I wanna be 'Grace under Fire " comedian is awful .
Just awful .
you have stayed at a Disney resort prepared to be wowed by the Wilderness Lodge .
The themes are carried to the hilt the service is unbelievable .
I have only been to Disney twice but we have stayed at the lodge both times .
During our visit this September our daughter came down with a 102.4 degree fever .
While I was freaking out about being stuck at the resort a vehicle , the resort managers arranged to have Judy , a wonderfully friendly front desk clerk , drive us the full twenty minutes to "After Hours Pediatrics" .
She also came to pick us up when when we were ready .
The next morning a personalized , autographed picture of the Little Mermaid was slid under our door wishing that Emily well enough to come visit in person .
The children are truly the guest at Disney they are treated as specially as the paying adults are treated .
While you prepare to spend a pretty penny to stay in the park , the service convenience make it worth it .
only are you able to purchase the Ultimate Park Hopper ticket (unavailable to those staying on site ) , you are right in the middle of the action , you don't have to fight traffic , you are able to make it back to your room in about 15 minutes from anywhere in the Walt Disney World complex .
Prepared to be impressed; .
Logistics
The Wilderness Lodge is one of what are sometimes called the " Magic Kingdom Resorts " at Walt Disney World .
It is one of the deluxe resorts which means it is a little more expensive than most of the other Disney Resorts .
While the resort is on the monorail line , you hop on a boat to the Magic Kingdom take a bus to anywhere else on Disney property .
We took a towncar from the airport did have a car the whole trip .
Aside from the unexpected illness , we have needed a vehicle .
Disney provides great access to transportation every cast member is ready to provide detailed directions tips for getting to your desired destination quickly .
Is This Really Florida ?
When you first enter the lodge you immediately notice the grand openness of the design .
The Wilderness Lodge also has a small alcove for children to watch a Disney cartoon while Mom Dad check into the room .
At the back of the lobby is a wooden bridge that spans a "bubbling brook" .
It turns into a little stream that flows out of the lobby to flow into the swimming pool outside ( though I doubt it actually does ) .
There are always kids running back forth over the bridge they ca n't resist !
I love the way the atmosphere makes you relaxed .
It does normally take some time to check into your room since there is more than the normal information to go over .
" Cast Members " often give guests tips to further enjoy the park .
The guest service desk is typically used to arrange childcare Priority Seating at resort restaurants after you have checked in .
Check in is normally 3:00 pm .
However , we arrived around noon our room was available .
This is guaranteed as I did notice other families that were waiting at the pool until their room was ready .
The resort consists of two wings with seven floors 728 rooms .
The seventh floor is reserved for concierge rooms is accessible from the elevator swiping your room key .
While we were there in a typically quiet season , the hallways remained quiet there always to be an elevator waiting for us when we needed one .
There are 3 room views available .
-The Standard View faces the parking lot , driveway , the roof ;
-The Woods View faces the woods on one side the Wilderness Lodge Villas on the other ;
-The Courtyard View looks over one of the pools Bay Lake .
Pricing
The standard room which has 2 queens a queen with bunk beds ranges from $ 199/night to $ 324/night .
The concierge rate ranges from $ 250/night to $ 385/night .
There are differing views "honeymoon suites " that offer different amenities price ranges .
Okay , Now Onto the Rooms Themselves
The door of the actual room opens to a hallway with a small 3-4 drawer chest to the left as well as a closet with sliding doors that includes a small safe .
There is a an alcove to the right that has a nice black marble sink mirror .
You access the functional bathroom from a door on the right .
In addition to the towel rack there is hook to hang clothes wet towels on as well as a clothes line that be pulled across the length of the bathtub .
The sleeping area in the room we stayed had two queen size beds with a night stand between them .
The beds were on wooden frames that lent themselves to frequent toe stubbings but the sheets were soft the pillows were fluffy .
The room was furnished with a wooden table with two chairs as well as a dresser with 3 four drawers on the bottom an television cabinet on the top .
The colors were a muted turquoise orange the wooden furniture was a rich maple color .
It has a small glass topped table two all-weather chairs .
To my delight the hotel was constructed to provide privacy on these balconies .
You see your neighbor's balcony they see yours .
Shopping
The hotel amenities include the usual gift shop with a wilderness theme .
There is plenty there to satisfy your "souvenir sweet tooth" .
Dining
The Whispering Canyon Café provides delicious family style barbeque dinners .
While we enjoyed the dinner at the restaurant twice the first time we stayed , we only were able to go for breakfast this time .
The food was outstanding .
The prices for breakfast were reasonable , but for dinner to pay $ 40-50 for a family of three .
Normally this steep to me but it is comparable to any other sit-down restaurant at Disney .
you enjoy Disney's famous themed restaurants , you'll love this .
The servers move through out the dining room using the tray stands to make "galloping " sounds .
They frequently yell "woo-hoo" scream "who has the ketchup " whenever someone asks .
The kids love it .
I have been to this restaurant , but it has been described as " a celebration of the rich culinary heritage of the Pacific Northwest " .
Roaring Forks is cafeteria-type dining offers burgers , fries , pizza , chili , bagels , deli sandwiches , Rice Krispie treats , beverages other fresh fast selections .
While the prices are high for my standards - you pay $ 6.00 for turkey on a croissant , the food is good just right for a quick lunch by the pool .
The Territory Lounge serves cocktails , espresso cappuccino as well as appetizers in the evening .
Entertainment
The Wilderness Resort's pool is huge , clean , definitely relaxing !
But you will want to go down to watch the geyser that erupts hourly on the beach .
you exit the hotel near the gift shop you will find a video game room that I is called " Buttons Bells " .
It is larger than the average hotel arcade offers newer games as well as the old stand-bys such as centipede pinball .
The Cub 's Den be accessed by an entrance near the arcade .
The room is chock full of video games , Disney toys , books , craft supplies Disney movies .
I highly recommend the services .
I felt comfortable my daughter was well cared for as it was staffed by two grandmotherly women who to love taking care of children .
It afforded us the opportunity to see more than Mickey the Princesses have an adult conversation .
While I am sure some families used the service every night of the week , once was enough for us to enjoy an evening of adult activity .
To Sum it Up
Looking at some of the other reviews I am the only one to recommend Disney 's Wilderness Lodge .
It is clean , beautiful the cast members are indulgent responsive .
Right next to the Yacht Club at Walt Disney World is the Beach Club Resort .
Although many the two hotels are identical , they are in fact , very different .
Location : The Beach Club resort is right in the middle of EPCOT MGM Studios .
It 's actually walking distance to both theme parks .
This be really convenient because you go out to the front of the resort where the Disney busses pick you up ( free transportation to anywhere on Disney property ) , it crowded , you take a left right ( depending on which park you are heading to ) take a scenic walk to the gates .
The Beach Club is also within a few minutes of almost all other places on property , including Disney Village , Typhoon Lagoon , Fantasia Golf , the Boardwalk .
The Rooms : With 583 guest rooms , there are 4 different types of rooms to choose from :
-Standard View/King Bed - view of the garden parking lot , bed folds out from wall .
-Standard View/2 Queens/Kings - view of garden of parking lot .
-Water , Pool View/2 Queens/Kings - view of pool lake .
-Standard View/Deluxe Room , view of a garden , woodland parking area
I 've stayed in two different rooms at the Beach Club .
One was a standard room with a "view " of the parking lot .
The second was a suite , which also had a view of the parking lot .
Both rooms were very alike , that the suite was bigger had a smaller balcony .
Both of the rooms had 2 Queen size beds which were pretty comfortable a television facing the beds .
A Table chairs were in the corner of the room .
Two sinks were right outside of the bathroom the shower toilet were on the inside .
It was funny to find a telephone television speakers inside of the bathroom too !
Every morning at the Beach Club , a paper is delivered right outside your door .
On both sides of the lobby , there are cushioned seats around beautiful flowers .
you like relaxing indoors , you sit down in one of the comfortable chairs couches in the lobby .
When you go outside , you will find rocking chairs some beautiful topiary pieces .
The last time I was there , there was a huge butterfly as soon as you walk out of the lobby .
Just across the Boardwalk is the beach the lagoon , where you sit on a swing enjoy the beautiful day .
The pool is shared with the Yacht Club , which is adjacent to the Beach Club .
There are actually 3 different pools in this area they are all different so everyone enjoy them ! .
The first pool that you see when you walk out of the Beach is Stormalong Bay .
But Stormalong Bay does n't only have a water slide !
It also has a whirlpool , "quicksand " one spot where you swim into a huge pool of bubbles .
you cross over to the next pool , you will the current pull you along .
Hot tubs are located in the middle of Beaches Cream Stormalong bay .
There are a couple quiet pools that you also go to , which are open really late at night .
The Food : you 're looking for a quick snack a sit-down dinner , the Beach Club has it all .
Out by the pool is Hurricane Hanna 's where you get alcoholic beverages , hamburgers , hotdogs , chicken fingers cookies .
Poolside beverage service is available all day from Hurricane Hanna 's .
Beaches and Cream Soda Shop is just a couple minutes away .
This restaurant is great because it looks like an old soda fountain shop .
Here , they offer meals , like turkey club sandwiches hamburgers you just order some ice cream to go .
you are looking for a full-service restaurant , then you try the Cape Café .
Every morning , the buffet restaurant has a Character breakfast with Goofy , Chip Dale , Minnie Mouse .
Every night , an indoor clambake buffet offers clams , mussels , beef-ribs , chicken some great desserts !
Martha's Vineyard is located inside has a different selections from different vineyards .
The Rip Tide is a lobby lounge that has wines , wine coolers , beers , cocktails , frozen drinks .
The only thing I do n't like about the Beach Club 's food is that there is n't a food court , even a small 24 hour court that offers snacks .
Other restaurants be found just a few minutes away at the Yacht Club right even on the Boardwalk .
Beaches Cream Hurricane Hanna 's are only open for so long ...
The Service : There are many different services that are offered at the Beach Club .
you need customer service Valet parking , someone is always there to help you .
Everyone always has a smile on their face .
There is even a " Greeter " who is dressed as a ship 's captain who says good morning and/or welcome to you every time you leave come back !
Some of the other services that they have are kid 's programs at the Sandcastle Club , an Arcade , A health club a barber/hairdresser salon .
There are facilities right at your fingertips where you rent boats , play tennis , volleyball even croquet .
The Beach Club is also perfect for business conventions .
Sharing a huge facility with the Yacht Club , the two resorts have a 73,000 square foot function area that also has a 36,000 square foot Ballroom 21 breakout rooms .
Every time I stay there , I have a lot of fun I bet you will too !
The title of my epinion is a quote from our waiter our very first evening at this beautiful resort .
I 've stayed anywhere else that even comes close to being as nice .
Service
Ordinarily , I 'd start off a hotel/resort review with a description the rooms but what makes the Hyatt Regency Kauai unique is the service .
You are made to as you are an imposition that all you are valued for is the money in your pockets .
As soon as you drive up to the front entrance , you are greeted by a bellhop who takes your luggage opens the beautiful double doors for you to enter the lobby .
You are given a lei escorted to the check in desk .
Both times I 've stayed here , my basic standard parking lot view room has been upgraded .
We do n't spend a lot of time in our room so I do n't like to pay for a view .
I 'll walk outside to see the ocean !
For our first stay , we received a garden view room with a gorgeous view of blooming plumeria trees , multi-colored crotons , birds of paradise the opportunity to see some weddings take place .
Our second stay was a last minute decision as we were traveling with my in-laws .
They had made reservations at the Aston Poipu Kai where our condo was absolutely unacceptable .
It was filthy , hot there was a bedspring literally sticking out of the mattress .
I called the Hyatt upon our check-in at the Aston .
They were sold out for that night but found us rooms for the rest of our stay , at a discounted rate too !
Another time , we had scheduled a Na Pali Coast boat tour we were canceled on three days in a row for various problems ( with more than one company ! ) .
The concierge found us two spots on another company 's boat for the last day of our honeymoon .
Unfortunately , that too was canceled ( by weather ) but the fact that someone tried very hard to make our vacation special meant a lot to us .
Rooms
For both visits , I had a room in the Poipu wing of the hotel .
There are two wings ( Poipu Shipwreck ) each be a long walk to the lobby area .
The rooms are very large each of them has a lamp in the shape of a rooster .
Since there are so many roosters running around in the wild on Kauai , it appropriate .
The shampoo conditioner is manufactured by Emlin is one of the few I 've tried that really get your hair squeaky clean after being out in salt water all day damaging your hair .

Review Topic : Overview
Clearly the jewel of Downtown Las Vegas , The Golden Nugget Hotel Casino has lost its luster since Steve Wynn sold it over a year ago .
The Nugget is a five star hotel/resort in every aspect , is a bargain , to boot .
I 've stayed at the Golden Nugget a score of times over the past two decades , it just keeps getting better better .
Accomodations
Rooms at the Golden Nugget are spacious luxurious .
Currently decorated in neutral colors a with a French Provincial decor , each room has a large credenza housing a TV , a table two side chairs , bedside tables with clock radio phone/message service , a dressing/makeup table complete with magnifying mirror .
The bathroom is very large , with marble floor , large Corian counter with sink , very large fluffy towels a REAL bath mat in place of the usual towel mat .
I 've had a less than perfectly clean fully operational room at the Nugget .
It 's a quiet , relaxing place to stay .
Hotel/Resort Ambience
The hotel lobby is white marble , graced by huge , fresh flower arrangements a mural-sized original oil painting by LeRoy Neiman .
The pool has a large fully equipped spa exercise facility , a beautiful outdoor pool area , , of course , a vast casino .
Its Carson Street cafe serves excellent " coffee shop " food , their buffet is excellent reasonably priced , there are three specialty restaurants : California Pizza Kitchen , Stephano 's ( Italian ) Lily Langtry 's ( Mandarin Chinese ) .
There are other shops at the Nugget .
Because there are attractions for children , you wo n't find them wandering through the casino hotel hallways .
Casino
The casino is large very well lighted .
Table minimums are usually $ 5, though an occasional $ 3 blackjack table be found on weekday afternoons .
All blackjack is dealt out of the shoe .
Pai gow poker , Caribbean stud , roulette , craps , baccarat are offered , there is a special area for "high stakes " players .
As with most casinos these days , slot machines video poker machines dominate the casino layout , though they are overly noisy obtrusive .
Cocktail waitresses circulate frequently offering free beverages .
Casino employees are friendly helpful , for the most part .
It 's a pleasant place to gamble , though I usually go elsewhere , since single-deck blackjack favors the player .
Conclusions
the greatest incentives in staying at the Nugget ( besides its adult atmosphere ) are its proximity to several other casinos downtown its outstanding quality for money spent .
Rates are modest by Vegas standards , given the luxury of this resort .
Once you stay at the Golden Nugget several times , you are invited to join their " Private Arrangement " club , where discounts freebies are offered to frequent guests .
It 's a jewel that is worth many times its modest price .
We had spent part of our honeymoon there in 1975 we both wanted to go back when we afford it .
It ended up taking 25 years ( Epinions ) to complete our dream .
With all the family expenses , including a daughter in college , it became to save enough to make reservations to stay there .
In November of 1999 I was introduced to Epinions thus , after writing reading many hours , we were able to afford to make reservations thus our 25th anniversary dream came true .
Thanks to all who read my articles helped make this milestone in our lives come true .
A Brief Description
There's so much I write about this outstanding Resort in central Florida .
We arrived on Monday morning checked in to our room .
In the Polynesian Resort there are many Long Houses ' where they have 3 floors of rooms in each .
The buildings are named Tonga , Aotearoa , Fiji , Tuvalu , Samoa , Niue , Hawaii , Tokelau , Rapa Nui , Rarotonga .
Then there is the Great Ceremonial House .
Here is housed the registration desk numerous restaurants shops .
It is a two-floor building with a waterfall in the center , which is surrounded with tropical plants flowers .
This wondrous tableau is two stories tall completely takes up the center of the building .
There is a guest laundry room a video game room for the kids .

Our Building
We stayed in the Hawaii building which is a Concierge Service building .
Included as part of this service is a 2nd floor room where we go have a variety of foods during each day .
From 7:00 a.m.
till 10:30 a.m. they provide fresh fruits , juices , danish , cereals , teas , fresh brewed coffee is called Kakahiaka ( morning service ) .
From 12:00 p.m. till 4:00 p.m. we have Guava juice , lemonade , tea as well as various types of cookies this is called Auinala ( afternoon service ) .
From 5:00 p.m. till 7:00 p.m. we have available a selection of wines , light hors d'oeuvres , soda fruit juices this is called Ahiahi ( evening service ) .
finally from 8:00 p.m. till 10:00 p.m. visitors have a sampling of fantastic desserts a wide choice of cordials .
You were encouraged to take soda , water snacks back to your room for later consumption .
There was also expert staff in the building from 7:00 a.m.
till 10:00 p.m. each day to assist you with any problem that arise to assist in making reservations for dining special events .
Dining
In the Polynesian Resort there are several places to dine .
The biggest most elaborate is the nightly Luau held in Luau Cove .
This is a family style meal with pork chicken served with fruits , vegetables bread .
For dessert is pineapple cake .
During the meal is a Polynesian theme floorshow , complete with male female dancers in traditional costume .
We are Cousins ' treated like family .
The meal consisted of pork dumplings , spring rolls , smoked salmon , noodles , steamed vegetables , grilled pork , turkey , top sirloin , jumbo shrimp .
Dessert is sliced fresh pineapple caramel sauce .
It's easy to get a seat early but for evening dining reservations are recommended .
Appetizers are available from 5:00 p.m. till 10:00 p.m. daily .
The Kona Café is an excellent place for a morning eye opener a family breakfast like Tonga Toast .
Overall
As I mentioned earlier we were there 25 years ago liked it so much we went back for our 25th anniversary .
I only that this time it will be 25 more years .
It's a great place for the entire family .
You are greeted with "Aloha ! " by all the staff .
Every question is answered in a quick efficient manner .
you want reservations to a show dinner they make you like they really want to make them for you .

I recently took a trip to Disney stayed at this resort for 8 nights .
The rooms were a decent size .
For each different themed building , there were different accessories to decorate each room .
For example , there were paintings of surfers beaches in the surfing building .
Each room has 2 queen sized bed , but I you also stay in a room with a single , king sized bed .
Next to the sink area , there is a closet , a safe , a bathroom .
The bathroom itself is quite small , but the shower is a standard size with adjustable water pressure .
While the room was n't so bad , there were things that I liked did n't like about The All Star Sports , like many hotels .
First : the excellent price I got for nightly stays .
The All-Star Resort offers the cheapest hotel rate in all of Disney property !
Prices range from $ 89 dollars a night to $ 135 , which is really good for staying on property .
Second : The transportation provided by Disney at the All Star is the most efficient method of transportation in all of Disneyworld .
On average , I waited about 10 minutes for each bus to arrive to the different parks .
Even better , there is only one stop for many of the busses .
At other hotels , you have to go from place to place to place before you actually make your way to the park .
Third : The food court provided by the All Star is great !
There are many different varieties of food found here , like an Italian place ( pizza , spaghetti/meatballs ) , a fastfood stand ( hamburgers , chicken fingers ) , "home-cooked " meals ( meatloaf ) an all-day breakfast stand so you get donuts in the afternoon you really wanted to .
Disney also sells a mug for about $ 10.00 that you use at the soda machines during your entire stay .
10 bucks like a lot right now , but it saves you a lot of money because you get drinks at your leisure .
The So All Star ...

Eventually , Buddy is sent back to his home town of New York to find his biological father ( James Caan ) .

ever there was a pregnant premise for comedy , a naive , six-foot-tall elf set loose in unforgiving New York City ought to be it .

Elf is inoffensive enough , kids will lap it up .

It tells the story of 2 friends named Chris Annie who are members of their local Women's Institute , but when Annie 's husband comes down with Leukemia their lives are shattered .
Before he died he wrote a poem about his flowers , mentioned how flowers are like Women , they get more beautiful with age ( note-this does necessarily reflect my own opinion ) .
After he 's died the 2 of them decide to try raise some money for a comfortable sofa in the hospital waiting room so that other grieving families at least have a little comfort .
However since the women 's Institute makes money off their sales Chris decides to try a different approach , gets a few of the other members to join her in making a nude calendar .
That 's nude , naked , because they that as long as they keep themselves covered behind fruit things then it will be OK .
Needless to say the Calendar is more than a local success , by the time Hollywood beckons they have enough money to buy a settee still donate 99 % of their earnings to cancer research .
As with most comedy 's of this type the main reason is succeeds is it 's absolutely charming cast .
The 2 main characters alone are played by award winning actresses , Chris by Helen Mirran ( The Madness Of King George ) Annie by Julie Walters ( Educating Rita ) both give wonderful performances .
Mirran absolutely nails the role of the fun loving Chris who has to remain down to earth for the sake of her companions .
Walters gives a touching performance as the grieving widow determined to do anything to make money for others in her situation , but together their partnership becomes even more than the sum of it 's parts .
They display an amazing amount of chemistry play off of each other 's style just enough to keep the characters believable .
They 're well by an absolutely stellar cast though .

Crosbie the other actresses did n't have to rely on just themselves though because they had the of some good writers .
The film featured quite a few genuine laugh out loud moments , such as the scene where Chris 's son his friend walk in whilst she 's demonstrating the modeling .
That other jokes had the audience literally roaring with laughter .
Yet what I liked best about the writing was the jokes themselves , but with the way the material was handled .
It actually gets the whole central story of making the calendar out of the way surprisingly early , but then goes on to examine the effects that modeling nude had on their lives .
Chris 's teenage son feels so humiliated by the calendar that he turns to , what he believes are drugs ; another of the women arrives home to find her husband leaving her for another woman .

This review is based on my own opinion as a family man and father of three boys , ages 4 , 8 and 11 .
I consider myself a moderate person that is not overly protective or overly liberal .
I believe parents are responsible to find a balance in making our kids aware of reality while at the same time protecting them ( and their innocence ) from it .
I love Dr. Seuss stories .
I grew up reading his books and still enjoy reading them to my sons .
Shame on me for not checking the rating before taking the kids to the theater .
I think this rendition of the story would make Dr. Seuss roll over in his grave .
The movie is absent 4-letter words and explicit sex scenes , but the inappropriate-for-children content and mature innuendos in this movie overshadow the story line and plot .
There were enough instances that I cannot recall all of them , but multiple times during the movie I felt uncomfortable wondering if any of my three sons understood the inappropriate jokes .
I later discovered my 11 year old understood all of them ( I wish he had n't ) , my 8 year old understood about 1/2 of them , and my 4 year old is still innocent enough to understood none of them ( except the "butt scene " ) .
The most memorable moments that I did not appreciate are the "butt scene " - where the cat was outfitted with a large bare bottom , using the term " Dirty Ho " - referring to a dirty gardening hoe , and an acronym for the cat 's vehicle is S.H.I.T.
This story is written more for parents who are Mike Meyers fans more than it is for small children .
It is full of funny faces , personality shifts , and one-liners that are classic Meyers .
Kids like the quick transition and can relate to the main characters who are a boy and girl .
The story line and plot itself is poor and does n't flow nearly as smooth as a Dr. Seuss 's classic should .
This rendition pales in contrast to the other Seuss classic that was released in recent years , " The Grinch" .
In all fairness , my children enjoyed the movie .
As an added bonus , my 8 year old said " Dirty Ho " for the first time and thanks to his older brother , now understands it too .
This movie will leave you wanting more ... of NEMO , that is .

Calendar Girls , which has already seen a release in Britain , will be making its way over the Atlantic in time for the holiday season .
Luckily , I get these nice invitations from the Philadelphia Film Society to attend sneak previews premieres , so my wife I found ourselves treated to a free screening of this film a good month before it hits theaters .
For me , the big-screen experience is all about stunning visuals , thundering sounds , jaw-dropping special effects .
That said , I completely enjoyed Calendar Girls as a happy , spirited , light-hearted , peculiarly English comedy .
Characters and Plot
The Knapely chapter of the Women 's Institute ( W.I. ) is n't very interesting .
Topics like the history of broccoli carpets tend to predominate the presentations , right from the beginning , we find ourselves laughing along with our two main protagonists , Annie ( Julie Walters ) Chris ( Helen Mirren ) , as they suffer through the deadly dull pontifications that make up the WI meetings .
Fairly soon after his death , the Knapely W.I. finds itself once again in the position of having to publish its annual calendar for charity .
of the usual church buildings pictures of Yorkshire , however , Chris decides that something different is needed .
After receiving some inspiration from one of her son 's "adult " magazines a gas-station biker-chick calendar , she conceives the of a calendar picturing various members of the W.I. in the nude .
Of course , they be doing very W.I.-appropriate activities while in their birthday suits , so it be more classy than crass .
The money raised go to the local hospital 's leukemia ward .
Soon , despite opposition from the local chapter president , some last-minute pleas to the general W.I. convention , the calendar goes to press .
What follows is a media frenzy that was entirely unexpected , leading to BBC spots , tabloid reporters , Late Night appearances , sleazy Hollywood directors , lots lots of money raised for the local hospital .
What Did I ?
I really liked Calendar Girls .
One of the wonderful elements of this picture is its celebration of beauty outside of Hollywood magazine pages .
Helen Mirren , undeniably a very attractive older woman , brings a spark of glamour to the story , but the very ordinariness of many of the other women , the art with which they are presented in the calendar is a refreshing reminder that beauty be more than we see in Cosmopolitan Access Hollywood .
Despite all the high-sounding declarations above about beauty truth , the simple fact is that this is a fun movie .
The subject matter lends itself to all sorts of hilarity .
From the reactions of the models ' husbands families , to the media blitz , there are many moments of outright laughter throughout the film .
Anything Wrong With It ?
There were a few flaws I found in Calendar Girls .
A few conflicts were developed that found any resolution in the film .
Of course , there is absolute necessity to wrap everything up neatly by the end of an hour a half , but it is nice to see at least the beginnings of a resolution on most of the issues .
One particular storyline involving Chris 's son does provide a few comedy a few drama moments , but peters out , is lost in the wash of the story 's climax .
The other small complaint I express regards the Hollywood furor that develops around the Knapely women .
This segment of the film , while funny at times , devolves into a not-too-subtle critique of Hollywood the television industry .
I just found that portion to be a bit more forced than the rest .
Final Thoughts
Calendar Girls is quite simply an all-around enjoyable film .
The acting is solid , the premise is believable ( good thing , as it 's based on a true story ) , the whole experience is rife with humor .
The few flaws hardly detract from the general sense of enjoyment engendered by the movie .
Even this kind of film is n't your cup of tea , about renting it when it hits your local video store .
It 's definitely worth seeing you 're home for a quiet evening .

Sometimes , the problem with writing a review is just knowing whom you're writing it for .
That's because your target audience is an important consideration when you're recording your impressions on any given product .
Do they have the same taste as you ?
Will they at least be able to understand your analysis critique ?
Any reviewer has his her own biases , after all .
It's important for a reader to identify this , then take any advice in a review accordingly .
So what's the point of all this in relation the Universal Pictures ' The Cat in the Hat ? We're getting there , so please be patient .
They've also marketed it to the max , Cat in the Hat merchandise is to be seen lately just about everywhere you go .
There's just one problem with this that I see .
Above all , this is a children's film ( though some adults will enjoy it ) .

Bad Santa is the most deliciously gut-busting adults only comedy since 1999 's South Park : Bigger , Longer Uncut .
Directed by Terry Zwigoff ( Ghost World ) , produced by the Coen brothers ( Fargo , The Big Lebowski ) , Bad Santa stars Billy Bob Thornton as Willie T Soke , a plus-size bottom sex craved depressed alcoholic who cracks safes .
His partner in crime is Marcus ( Tony Cox , Me , Myself Irene ) .
As a team , they set up shop in a different city each Christmas , Thornton as the department store Santa , Cox as one of his elves .
On Christmas Eve , they rob the department store blind , usually to the tune of six figures in cash untold value in merchandise .
The set up this year is Phoenix , Arizona .
They get a job at a mall , replacing a 5 years running Santa thanks to the penny pinching attitude of the mall/store ( it 's which one he really is ) manager , played by the late John Ritter in one of his final film roles .
The manager then goes to the mall security guard , Gin ( Bernie Mac ) , who is on a power trip that just wo n't end .
" The Kid " ( as Thornton refers to him throughout the movie ) follows Thornton to a bar .
It 's in this bar where Thornton meets Sue ( Lauren Graham ) , a girl with a big time Santa fetish .
When Thornton realizes the kid has followed him , he takes him back home , where Thurman lives with his whacked out grandmother ( his parents are away for reasons that are revealed through the course of the film ) , played by Cloris Leachman .
Over the course of the movie , Marcus does his best to keep Willie out of trouble .
It is n't easy , given Willie 's penchant for having sex in the plus size fitting rooms , showing up late drunk to work , becoming slower slower on the safecracking year after year .
Willie , meanwhile , becomes a sort of father figure to Thurman , despite the fact that he sees nothing but a loser in the kid .
He questions why he does n't stand up to the skate punks who pick on him , tries his best to teach him to fight .
One that with this set up , a warm , happy ending is in the cards .
again .
What makes Bad Santa such a good movie , just a funny one ( an apt description for say , Mallrats , which is far from good , but damned funny ) , is that it holds expectations for itself .
It crashes down on the holiday season the way that the previously mentioned South Park film crashed down on musicals .
The Kid does bring out a bit of humanity soul whatever in Thornton 's character , but because Thornton 's ' Santa ' is so black in spirit , any redemption humanity is short lived .
The one drawback to the film is in some of its pacing editing .
The scenes between Ritter Mac in particular like they were n't even shot at the same time with them in the same room .

Bad Santa has officially topped Pirates of the Caribbean Bruce Almighty as my favorite film of the year .
I give it 4.5 stars a hearty HO HO HO recommendation .

Often touted as America's Sweetheart , Julia Roberts has made some nice , lighthearted films like "Pretty Woman" , "Steel Magnolias" , "Notting Hill" , "My Best Friend's Wedding " and her Oscar-winning role in "Erin Brokovich" .
Since winning the Oscar for Best Actress , Roberts went on a detour to experiment more as an actress , notably with independent filmmaker Steven Soderbergh , who she worked on "Erin Brokovich " for films like "Ocean's Eleven" , "Full Frontal" , and George Clooney's directorial debut for "Confessions of a Dangerous Mind" .
Some wonder if Roberts ' experiment would be a detour from Hollywood but she decided to return to her leading lady status for the all-prep school drama "Mona Lisa Smile" .
"Mona Lisa Smile " is about a 1953 subversive art teacher from UCLA who goes to the east coast , All-women School of Wellesley College to teach a group of overachieving students to find alternatives to marriage .
Along the way , she has to endure the rigid , conservatism of the school , its students , and the façade society that is the 1950s .
Directed by Mike Newell and written by the team of Lawrence Konner and Mark Rosenthal , "Mona Lisa Smile " might seem like the female version of Peter Weir's 1989 masterpiece "Dead Poets Society" .
Apparently , it is n't nor should it even be compared to "Dead Poets Society" .
Hailed as one of the most anticipated films of 2003 , "Mona Lisa Smile " comes off as a bland , mediocre mesh of a film that leaves too many unanswered questions and contrived messages .
Not even the film's young cast of Kirsten Dunst , Ginnifer Goodwin , Julia Stiles , and Maggie Gyllenhaal along with Dominic West , John Slattery , and Marcia Gay Harden could save this disappointment called "Mona Lisa Smile" .
The film begins when former UCLA teacher Katherine Watson ( Julia Roberts ) who arrives at the station for Wellesley College , an all-women's school in Massachusetts where she's been hired to teach in the art department for its students .
Watson meets up with staff and lives in the house with fellow teacher , Nancy Abbey ( Marcia Gay Harden ) who has an affixation with TV show " I Love Lucy" .
On Watson's first day , she meets up with her class to show them slides of paintings and every student identify the painting as such like robots and Watson finds herself being challenged .
She talks to Nancy and school nurse Amanda Armstrong ( Juliet Stevenson ) about the first day saying it was fine .
Fellow classmates Constance Baker ( Ginnifer Goodwin ) and Giselle Levy ( Maggie Gyllenhaal ) however find something different about as Giselle considered it aggressive and erotic .
Betty is n't fond of Watson's subversive tactics although the rest of her classmates including valedictorian Joan Brandwyn ( Julia Stiles ) find them refreshing .
Giselle however , thinks Watson is great as she plays around a lot carrying a diaphragm around her that she got from the school nurse .
Betty , being the snitch , writes about Armstrong giving out contraceptives that forced to be fired by the school's rigid , conservative president Jocelyn Carr ( Marian Seldes ) .
Katherine finds herself in a dangerous position wondering if she should continue to challenge the system while finding a bit of sympathy from the school's Italian professor Bill Dunbar ( Dominic West ) .

What makes "Mona Lisa Smile " such a disappointing film in many levels is rooted in its script .
The script leaves too many plot holes about why is Katherine being subversive , what emotional reasons is Giselle having for these affairs , why the school is trying to be protective of new things , and why is this script such a mess ?
Then again , this is what should be expected from the likes of Lawrence Konner and Mark Rosenthal since they wrote such awful films like the "Planet of the Apes " and "Mighty Joe Young " remakes .
They leave too many characters with unanswered questions , rigid stereotypes ( in the male roles ) , generic film clichés including a very bland ending that leaves you with a sour taste in your mouth , and contrived messages that might upset the hardcore feminists .
Director Mike Newell , known for his great work in "Enchanted April " and "Donnie Brasco" does a somewhat , mediocre job although he can capture great dramatic moments , he does n't give anyone the idea on what type of film this should be .
Should this be a drama , a comedy , a thinking film , what ?
Newell still should be given credit for trying to make things interesting since the pacing of the film is attentive but it 's given a weak script with no sense of a singular direction to begin with .

The Last Samurai is a "historical " epic set in the 1870 's , as Japan started to move towards joining the ways of the modern ( Western ) world .
Algren , a soldier who 's personal demons has driven him to hard times , is brought in to train the Japanese military in the ways of modern warfare .
Unforturately for Algren , the Japanese leaders disregard his concerns of their readiness , send their unprepared forces into battle .
Wounded in the hands of the enemy , Algren is surprised by the relative kindness he is shown .
Slowly but surely , he begins to know love the ways of the Samurai , eventually turning his back on his former ways comrades .

Synopsis : Sally and Conrad learn to set limits on their misadventure , with a little help from Dr Seuss ' ( Theodor S. Geisel ) Cat in the Hat ( 1957 ) .
Analysis : There may not be many things that I 'm sure of , but I do know a few for absolute certain .
In fact , referring to them as children 's literature is a misnomer .
I 've vowed never to live through a holiday season when I do n't watch the animated How the Grinch Stole Christmas !
I 've even prepared green eggs and ham on a date (you could say that I ate them with a fox ) .
If he were still alive today , I might even have stalkerish tendencies .
I 'll begin with the only element of Cat in the Hat that I found acceptable -- the Seussian visuals .
Flip through any Seuss book and you 'll find some of the most colorful , creative and inspiring illustrations that exist .
Seuss never saw any reason not to redraw that which already exists , and neither did Bo Grinch .
Through a nice combination of animation and set-design , Seussian architecture lives on .
This creative re-engineering draws the viewer ( or reader ) into a parallel universe where age-old lessons can be taught or re-taught without the obstructions created in the minds of this one .
Drawing things as they 've never been drawn has also helped to maintain the timeless nature of Seuss ' work , and avoids the pitfalls of stereotypes and geographic isolation .
But this is where the film turns from Seussian into a a blueprint for disaster .
The illustration is just one element in the greater scheme .
To think of Dr. Seuss ' work as mere pictures , rhymes and morals is to insult his legacy .
Dr. Seuss was a creative visionary who never set any limits on imagination , and this is where Cat in the Hat fails to live-up to expectations .
Bo Grinch has obviously lived inside a box for his entire life .
He compromises on everything that made Dr. Seuss great in order to make a few ( billion ) bucks , and squanders every opportunity to build on greatness .
The liberties taken with the story mortalize a once timeless tale .
The most difficult hurdle to overcome was turning a story that is slightly longer than this review into a 1 hour and 15 minute feature length film .
This leads to Bo Grinch 's biggest mistake , allowing Mike Myers to run willy-nilly through the minds and hearts of the audience in the guise of the Cat in the Hat .
I kept wondering when he was going to be verklempt , and half expected his coos of " Wowwoo! " to be followed by " Wayne 's World !
Party Time ! Excellent ! "
Indeed , Mike Myers recycled his entire CV of SNL characters to create a Cat in the Hat that is unworthy of his name .
I 've long admired Mike Myers , and appreciate much of his work .
This simply was n't the venue for him to enlist his own brand of creative devices .
Sean Hayes shines through the rest of cast , but only in one of his roles .
I found him entirely unconvincing as Mr. Humberfloob , the mother 's slave-driving germaphobe of a boss .
As the fish , he 's wonderful .
For a character whose sole purpose is to antagonize the Cat in the Hat , he is surprisingly tolerable .
I think Alec Baldwin ( Quinn ) and Kelly Preston ( Mom ) do an adequate job , but I feel that their romantic relationship and the undercurrents of jealousy that come with it are entirely inappropriate for the story .
Spencer Breslin ( Conrad ) and Dakota Fanning ( Sally ) are just children themselves , and ca n't be held responsible for the awkwardness that is brought about by Bo Grinch and his grinchy ways .
( Yes , I realize that I 'm the same person who 's always saying there is n't enough nudity , but even I ascribe to some sense of good taste ) The references to a dirty hoe and a Playboy centerfold were entirely unnecessary .
Adults have never found this necessary to enjoy Seuss ' books ; and spoiling the pristine , although sometimes misunderstood , image of the Cat in the Hat is a low blow -- even for Mike Myers .
Final Comments : I 've droned on for far too long about a film that can be summed up in one ( of many ) four letter words ( s ) , Suck .
Cat in the Hat is an abomination , which should be watched at the peril of your childhood .
I never got to see the Things bump the kites on the wall !
And we did not like it .
Not one little bit .

The juxtaposition of the words British' comedy ' is enough to strike fear into the hearts of even the hardiest cinema-goer .
The film is based on the real-life events from a Yorkshire village a few years ago , although the Director was keen on maintaining that the individual characters in the film are themselves based on the real-life women .
Calendar Girls ' centres on the Knapeley Women's Institute , a clan of Yorkshire women who meet every week to sing receive talks on thrilling matters such as carpets broccoli .
Annie ( Julie Walters ) Chris ( Helen Mirren ) are long-standing friends who faithfully turn-up , despite the soporific subject matter .
When Annie's husband dies from leukaemia , the effervescent Chris comes up with the of the WI raising money for a new sofa in the hospital in John's memory .
Thanks to some creative inspiration from her son's soft-porn magazine big-breasted dolly-bird on the wall of the local bicycle repair shop , she comes up with the of a nude calendar .
However , of them imagine the impact that the calendar have over the coming weeks , as it transcends them to superstar status way beyond their village .
However , as Hollywood beckons , relationships begin to suffer ;
However , it 's the film's ability to maintain the earthy northern wit its subtle comedy which really makes it into a winner .
The northerness nudity inevitably leads it to be compared to The Full Monty' , but its quirks differentiate it from its predecessor there does to be an intention to mimic .
Mirren Walters , surely two of the most talented British actresses of their generation , give great performances bounce off each other beautifully , easily switching from comedy to drama when required being hammy trying too hard .
It is particularly interesting that Mirren , best known for her ice-maiden Jane Tennison in Prime Suspect' is the bubblier , more outgoing of the pair whilst Walters , Mrs Overall in Acorn Antiques ' is more reserved .
John ( played perfectly by Alderton ) is always optimistic upbeat during his illness , the scenes with Anne are warm touching rather than melancholy melodramatic .
This is a refreshing change from the usual screen morbid portrayals of terminal illness on the big screen .
The rest of the WI is also fabulously portrayed thanks to some great performances from the cast .
Complementing each other rather than any one person trying to dominate the screen , the marvellous cast match the playful script .
However , as you'd imagine , it manages to resolve itself before too long does n't detract from the overall feel-good factor .
A good old-fashioned straightforward plot with the emphasis on script characters rather than having a deep philosophical meaning , it is fantastically watchable jam-packed with witty one-liners appeal to a wide ranging audience .

The Last Samurai tells the story of Capt .
Nathan Algren ( Cruise ) , a courageous American soldier who is plagued by the guilt of a slaughter of innocent Indians ordered by his commanding officer .
Using what's left of his fame to sell Winchester rifles , Algren spends his days in solitude drowning in a bottle .
But it is only after his band of hastily trained soldiers is attacked Algren is captured by the rebels that he learns of their true fight : to preserve their way of life that is being threatened by western civilization .
Through contact with these "enemies " he is able to learn of honor , value love .
Cruise is a fine lead actor , stealing the spotlight , but always commanding enough presence for us to the film .
while I was n't always buying him as a genuine Samurai , he throws himself into the role with such determination that he deserves to be commended for his efforts , despite the fact that he is a Hollywood megastar ( which is hard to see past , regardless of how good the performance is . )
He is a fierce , honorable warrior , but also a loving leader who seeks to understand that which is outside his culture .
Of the film's villains , I can't be so praiseworthy .
While they do work fine in the framework of the story , they are the same static antagonists we see in every film like this , where their lust for "progress " gets in the way of human dignity , although , this be blamed on the story itself .
Don't get me wrong , the story is great .
It works perfectly for the film , because this is a character drama a war epic , a story-driven film .
There is need for an overly complex plot , because what we're to be drawn to here is these people why they're so willing to fight for what they in .
That being said , the film settles into that mold shines beautifully .
The environments here are breathtaking .
The valley where the Samurai village resides is quite one of the most beautiful set pieces in cinematic history .
Its citizens are well portrayed as well .
These are savage warriors as the early goings of the film have us , but they are families , fathers fighting to give their children some tradition to cherish .
The costumes are spot on , especially the Samurai armor .
When we first meet them thundering through terrestrial mists on horseback , it truly is a fearsome sight .
The film is beautifully scored , from the soft pieces of quiet reflection to the epic pieces of battle , is one of the only soundtracks so far this year that be worth buying ( Return of the King being the exception ) .
Hans Zimmer captures everything good about the film translates it musically .
the fight scenes , oh the fight scenes !
The film is intensely violent has a body count that rival even Kill Bill .
It's simply all out war , but it 's stylistic in its approach as well .
The film has one-on-one sword fighting , finding a windswept rain-soaked Cruise continually training himself in the way of the Samurai .
The Samurai fight for their honor against thousands of Japanese infantry , the battle is simply spectacular .
It is perfectly shot perfectly directed to an emotional resonance often found outside something like Peter Jackson's The Lord of the Rings .
It is a truly epic thing to see , with characters we have come to care for fighting for everything they .
There's even a scene with Samurai VS Ninjas !
It does n't get much better than that .
you quote me that the final battle here is epic enough that it rival even Pellannor Fields in Return of the King
Amidst the battle scenes are long moments of quiet reflection , light humor , poignant dialogue , all of which serve to draw us further into the story connect emotionally with the characters .
Cruise trains fiercely with the town warriors , refusing to stop until he longer move , earning the respect of the villagers .
Katsumoto says to Nathan on the dawn of battle , "You a man change his destiny ? " to which Cruise replies , " I a man does what he , until his destiny is revealed . "
Good stuff .
The Last Samurai is an epic action film that has a heart a brain .
It slows down to let us connect with its characters , then it throws those characters into a visual orgy of blood carnage .
The movie conveys the strength of the Samurai the honor they live by , the beauty of the ancient Japanese culture .
Everything about this film is beautiful I go as far as to rank it one of the year's best films .

It is to the endless credit of Thornton , an actor who has made a career out of socially maladjusted misfits ( " Sling Blade" , " A Simple Plan " ) , that he to have taken to this role a moment 's about what a monster like Willie do to his public image .
He growls the character 's endless obscenities with a phlegm-throated relish , throws himself into twisted misbehavior with heedless abandon ...and what 's most amazing of all , somehow manages , against all our better instincts , to move us with this portrayal of a hateful man by letting us forget that he hates himself most of all .

For all its dark R-rated excesses , " Bad Santa " is ultimately , like many of the greatest Christmas movies , a story of redemption .
Willie , in Phoenix with Marcus for their annual Christmas scam ( they 've been pulling their Santa heist for years , living high off the proceeds , but always financially dry as a bone come Thanksgiving ) , finds that the job will come as easy as it has to him in the past .
Their department store 's sharp-tongued detective ( Bernie Mac ) jittery manager ( John Ritter in his final film role ) are keeping a close eye on this suspiciously woozy Saint Nick .
What 's more , he has somehow , against all odds , made a friend .
At first , Willie takes advantage of the situation , moving into Thurman 's house , which the boy shares only with a deeply out-of-it grandmother ( Cloris Leachman ) ; his father is in prison for insider trading , his mother "is in heaven with God the baby Jesus ...and the talking walnut " .
But soon , Willie starts to realize that this sad sack of a kid , with his snot-crusted upper lip Cupid-curls hair , who gets beaten up on a daily basis by skateboard punks who exalts over an almost-all-C 's report card , needs almost as much help as Willie himself .
Thurman , to his credit , does that this bleary-eyed human trash heap is really Santa Claus .
He just desperately needs to in something , else one day he just find himself in a Santa suit , throwing up in an alley , just like his new best friend .
Thankfully , " Bad Santa " manages to tell this Yuletide story of a monster 's salvation resorting to the " Will Ferrell learns the true meaning of Christmas " cliches that have sent many a holiday audience into sugar shock over the years .
Director Zwigoff 's past films , including the remarkable documentary " Crumb " the dark but surprisingly sweet " Ghost World " , have evinced a soft spot for the disenfranchised misunderstood souls of the world , the miracle of those films is that he allows us to see embrace the humanity of these creatures soft-pedaling the weirdness nihilism that has made them outsiders to begin with .
Thurman 's plight does make a dent in Willie 's stone heart , but a dent is all it is ; for all we know , he 'll go right on boozing cussing banging fat chicks till his liver gives out they carry him out in a pine box .
Kelly , likewise , is your typical cookie-cutter cute movie kid .
Take " The Cat in the Hat " 's Spencer Breslin , add about seventy-five pounds , yellow-crusted underwear , ill-fitting shorts , an intensely eyes-locked-on-you manner that is as creepy as it is amusing , you understand why this kid gets pounded on every day .
But when Willie is dumbstruck by Thurman 's simple sweet Christmas gift of a wooden pickle , when Thurman announces that Santa has n't brought him a Christmas present for the last two years "because I know I 'm just a dips--t loser " ...you ca n't help but root for these guys .
Maybe to become president , but at least for Thurman to get the pink stuffed elephant he so dearly wants for Christmas .
At least for Willie to find a reason to rise from the booze-and-puke puddle that is his life see another dawn .
Still , regardless of how unexpectedly touching the film be , " Bad Santa " is still the blackest comedy in many a moon .
I am personally tired of Hollywood pictures billing themselves at "outrageous" , when really all that means is that they include a few gross jokes about bodily fluids ending up in somebody 's Sprite .
" Bad Santa " is the first comedy I 've seen in a long time that is outrageous in the literal sense of the term ; several critics have already excoriated it as mean-spirited beyond redemption , a possibly-apocryphal internet news item had Walt Disney CEO Michael Eisner ( Disney owns Miramax subsidiary Dimension , which released this film ) denouncing the picture as an insult to the memory of the company 's founder .
the film is guilty of everything it 's been accused of .

The movie industry be thinking the same thing starting this year especially after the success of last year's The Santa Clause 2 , which opened the first weekend of November to nearly $ 30 million .
New Line offers up their pre-holiday treat entitled Elf , which features the former Saturday Night Live comedian Will Ferrell , who has recently become a new rising star in Hollywood .
After the dismal first half of the year with flops like A Man Apart The Real Cancun , the studio bounced back in the second half with Freddy vs. Jason , Secondhand Lions , The Texas Chainsaw Massacre hopes to continue the trend until their mega-success The Return of the King opens near Christmas .

Buddy is the typical elf , his large size being the biggest factor .

But this is easier said then done as his father is a real Scrooge is prominently found on the naughty list .
Buddy , who has been to the human world , is unfamiliar with many of the things we are accustomed to like revolving doors food products that don't include sugar .
The unusually happy elf find a way to change his father's workaholic attitude help his new family find the true Christmas spirit .
The story for Elf , though on the predictable side especially as the feature starts to wind down , works surprisingly well .
This happens mostly in part to Ferrell's performance but there are also plenty of moments that come off as hilarious even the lead star .
Though the feature does n't have an exceptionally large cast , the film does n't have to with some lead characters picking up any slack left over by that .
Will Ferrell , who was featured earlier this year in the hit comedy Old School , once again proves he has as much comedic timing talent as he ever did on Saturday Night Live even more so .
Ferrell is able to make Buddy the elf both lovable hilarious pushing the personality of the character too far as to make him annoying pathetic .
James Caan , who takes on the role of Buddy's real father , has the grizzly workaholic business man down pat .
The only problem lied with Caan's performance but the character itself in how quickly the character changed his attitude at the end really having a change-of-heart experience .
Overall , Elf joins the ranks of such holiday features as The Santa Clause Dr. Seuss ' How the Grinch Stole Christmas that shows Hollywood is still able to make a yuletide classic as good as the old days .
It's the wonderful atmosphere Will Ferrell's exuberant performance that makes this film a delightful treat for the whole family enjoy one member of the family being alienated by certain material .

The Hip-Hop world is an ever-evolving place for Columbus producer RJD2 .
Two years ago , this guy was doing DJ work in the Columbus area as the lesser-known producer for the MHz .
Let 's put it simply say the man has made a name a reputation for himself .
A lot of this stems from his glorious solo debut , Deadringer .
While this is an Instrumental Hip-Hop album , trust me , you wo n't miss the lyrics .
While the album starts with the quirky , dense , mood-setting The Horror it quickly brightens up into a journey through the wonderful world of soul .
Smoke and Mirrors shows RJ filling a dark but wondrous track with hard trumpet loops reflective soul singing samples .
Ghostwriter skips the vocals completely goes with a boarderline country guitar sample which bursts joyously into triumphant horns that will leave you breathless .
Being a popular DJ around Ohio 's biggest campus ( Ohio State ) , RJD2 knows how to have a good time which is exemplified by Good Times Roll Pt . 2. I had a time machine , I 'm pretty sure RJD2 have sold this track to some Motown artist in the old-soul era .
It 's got all the dance , rhythm , atmosphere of a back-in-the-day party anthem .
To give us a Soul Position preview , Blueprint crashes the party on Final Frontier .
With a wicked piano riff a little added bounce , RJ sets 'Print up for an easy score .
'Print proves he 's up to it too , spitting , You 're ill you are / My notepads full of medicine / Plus my freestyle is Excederin/ Take two rhymes call me back with a new style / Be sure you 're prepared for the final frontier ( We 're here ! ) .
indeed , Soul Position has officially arrived on the scene .
Chicken-N-Bone Circuit shows his great love of hard drum loops as he forms one of the most chaotic , head-nod-inducing drum beats you will ever hear on wax .
On June he opts for atmosphere of the usual steady soul-loops while bringing along MHz emcee , Copywrite .
Between Copy 's tight intro/retrospective verses RJ digs out a beautiful guitar to drive home the passion of his fellow artist .
It 's one gripping track .
As he continues to ride the verge of complete success , those who know will always point to this album as his major coming out party .
Pick up Deadringer , you wo n't be disappointed .
Alcatraz is well known throughout the world as the notorious San Francisco Bay prison built in the 1930s .
In addition to housing such infamous figures like Al Capone George "Machine Gun" Kelly , the house of detention is best known for being completely inescapable .
Given the state of artist/label business relationships in rap music , its wonder that Bay-area rapper Rasco found the federal lockdown facility as a perfect metaphor for rap recording contracts , big names restricted to unfair conditions with little of freedom .
Fortunately , Rasco joins an elite minority of rappers able to escape "the Rock " with his career still intact .
After tunneling his way out of an unbalanced recording deal with Copasetik Records , the Cali Agent found his way into a more equitable agreement with Coup D'Etat that allows to make the music he wants to make with less restrictions .
This year , Rasco celebrates his newfound freedom by dropping his banging new LP , Escape From Alcatraz .
The story of Rasco's contractual incarceration is told in "Snakes In The Grass ( The Jon Sexton Story ) ."
A combination of street narrative slick diss track , the emcee recounts the bad situation he was in at his previous record company while sharing some choice words for his former employer .
On "My Life " Rasco contemplates complex issues such as morality , race , politics over a bouncy funk-electronica loop .
" U Got The Time" expresses the artist's desire for people to take control of their own destinies , rhyming with conviction over undeniable soul guitars vocals .
In fact , though the open hostilities toward his former label are liberally peppered throughout Escape From Alcatraz , Rasco's music is generally upbeat in nature .
The party mood is captured perfectly in "San Fran To The Town " featuring Hieroglyphic Casual tearing up the rich , warm guitar grooves with his cleverly slumpy vocals .
"Put Your Hands Up" "Real Hot" also exemplify the festive vibe with the former a triumphant return to the game over summer anthem-style accompaniment , while "Real Hot" features an innovative modification of the classic soul sample that Eric B Rakim made legend with "Microphone Fiend . "
Naturally there are a host of celebrities on hand to participate in the revelry , including long-time partner fellow Cali Agent Planet Asia .
The west coast Wonder Twins activate "Endless " with their gruff-voiced Cali big talk , trading sixteen bars of venom over echoing strings , chopped samples , hefty drums .
Chali 2na of the golden age-reminiscent Jurassic 5 lends his reverberating baritone to "The Sweet Science , " the two rap heavyweights unloading a flurry of battle raps spiked with boxing metaphor .
Rasco's lyrical footwork here make even Roy Jones Jr. proud : " I stick jabs in your abs stay in the lab rhyming / going for feints bad timing / this be the team that shatter your spleen/ I go twelve rounds , baby , till your clock is cleaned , knaamean ? "
It's mystifying why some record labels rather let artists spin their wheels doing trendy crap nothing at all , rather than allow them to make quality albums like Escape From Alcatraz .
Rasco's latest effort proves his ability to skillfully craft lyrics that dance between aggression , introspection , social awareness , while recruiting producers that adeptly balance his gruff demeanor with rich soul , jazz , funk-based production .
Rasco's situation prove encouraging for other artists , you be smashing rocks today , but stay diligent you'll be making smashes tomorrow .
Knowing that they are über appreciators of quality hip-hop made the choice as easy as jumpin' in my ride .
My sources tell me that Odds Evens is Defari's second full-length release , the first one being Focused Daily .
It also as though he is intimately connected to Dre his posse ( surprise there coming from LA ) .
My stereo is relatively bangin' so it 's a good place to test quality .
Good production in hip-hop usually equals how tightly the bass beats come out the speakers at high volume .
Often , bass starts to bleed , escaping the parameters of the speaker cone , creating distortion even blowing speakers .
There 's bleeding hear .
The tune is basically heavy bumpin' with lots of the lows , the same ones directly associated with that earthquake feeling you get when sitting at a red light next to one of those scary looking cars with the tinted windows , supa shiny rims , wide-a** tires that way too small .
Defari harkens back , reminding people that he still kick-it with the best .
The lows stay tight to the speakers , almost lifting the car with the volume cranked .
The adrenaline rush I got reminded me of high school when I used to crank Def Leppard Accept .
Fun stuff !
Another thing that struck me about Odds Evens was the variety of the lyrical content .
Defari comes across as a seasoned professional .
He brings up all kinds of subjects .
There is only one interlude only one cut shorter than 2 minutes .
The combination of Defari's mature west coast sound , tight lyrics , smooth vocal style create a lethal dose of BANG.
Although I like ALL of the tracks ( pretty impressive these days ) , here are some of my standouts :
Inner City has one of coolest hooks kinda like lowbump-bump-bump-bump-bump-bump-bumpbumpbumpbump-lowbump over a straightforward beat that hits with precision purpose .
Very west coast , very Dre inspired , very tough nasty .
Cold Pieces also has a hook that got stuck in my cranium long after the sound waves dissipated .
Tribal , eerie , otherworldly , tough .
Take The Weight Of My Hand is smooth relaxed .
Here Defari tells us a little about what makes him tick .
The syncopated bass line on the low mixes with the shrill pinning of keys on the high to create a tension that is only broken by Defari's smooth flow .
Lots of confidence attitude in this one although in-your-face .
Xtra Thump you already know how this goes .
Los Angelinos is a lovely orchestrated joint accented by a simply complex key hook that sets a mellow mood .
With urgency , Defari gives props to his hometown .
There are 10 others that I did n't mention as favorites but that 's just because people have short attention spans these days ( myself included ) .
I , , give props to Spell My Name ( the video single ) , the beautifully edgy Hooks , regal title track Odds Evens , even the bass horns of the finale Stay Bubblin' , etc .
Well , only that you are a fan of west coast hip-hop , simply want a place to start your west coast experience , have a pulse a CD player , you get down to your local music peddler pick up Odds Evens .
Defari is at the top of his game .
Also , further props to E-Swift Evidence of Dilated Peoples for their quality handling of the production duties .
Top shelf !
